About the job
At Jamf, people are at the core of everything we do. We do what’s right for our customers, our employees, our communities and our world. We take pride in simplifying technology for tens of thousands of customers around the globe and helping organizations succeed with Apple.

Jamf operates as a choice-based office model. Choose to work in the office, connect 100% remote from your home, or find the blend that works best for you.

This role is remote in Poland. We are only able to accept applications for those based in Poland or have sponsorship to live and work in Poland.

What you'll do at Jamf:

At Jamf, we empower people to be their best selves and do their best work. You will join a unit of Cloud Engineers that contribute to Jamf Security portfolio. Some of us work from one of our offices - Brno, Emmen and London - and others are partially or fully remote. We deploy our solutions on the best cloud providers - AWS, GCP and Azure. Our infrastructure is declared with Terraform and configured with Puppet. We build and maintain over 20 K8s and K3s clusters all around the world with Rancher at the helm of it.

If Data is the new gold and you are the King of Data… what does that make you? Not sure, but you are certainly a DBA! And if you are the type of DBA that is not married to a particular technology, likes to get his hands dirty and is interested in everything related to databases then you might be what we are looking for to scale our DBA team.

What we need from you:

The DBA Team owns many core database clusters in Production as well several other instances on a wide range of technologies. You will work alongside the rest of our DBAs in a small and agile team that owns their direction of travel.

Your primary focus will be scalability, integrity, performance, availability, security, monitoring and troubleshooting of our core DB clusters, exploring new ways of consolidating data sources and making more data available to more people at Jamf and last but not least supporting our Dev Teams as they build the new features that will shape the future of Jamf.

And if you are not scared of doing some coding, you can get involved in how we build and monitor our DBs, using technologies like Terraform and Prometheus.

Some of the traits we expect from you:
No challenge is too big or too small for you. You get excited at the prospect of a complex project and at the same time you understand that small improvements can sometimes make a massive difference.
You hold yourself and your team to a high standard when working in production.
You have some cloud experience, ideally with AWS.
You have experience with at least 2 different DB technologies as well as awesome SQL skills and ideally NoSQL as well. We use Dremio, Vertica, Mongo as well as other technologies. But we won’t frown upon you if Oracle is your cup of tea.
Exposure with Big Data and column based datastore technologies will be a nice bonus point.

Why will you love it here? ❤️
Named a Fortune Best Workplace in Technology, 2022.
Open and friendly culture (yes, everybody says that, join us and see for yourself 😉).
We offer flexible work-life in a choice-based office model.
Our house is full of experienced people with passion for knowledge sharing. Check our Engineering Blog: https://medium.com/jamf-engineering out for some inspiration .
$1,000 WFH stipend to better equip your home workspace, Apple gear, and restricted stock units.
You will work on a top security product and have the opportunity to make a real and meaningful impact across a wide range of sectors: education, healthcare and commercial (https://www.jamf.com/resources/case-studies/ )
30 days of holiday, paid Volunteering Time Off and of course, training support and other exceptional perks and benefits.

What is a Jamf?

You go above and beyond for others, are willing to help, and support the team around you. You value and learn from different perspectives. You are curious and resourceful, a problem-solver, self-driven and constantly improving. You are excited by not knowing what may lie ahead. You are willing to take risks, try new things, even fail just to do it better next time. You’re not a jerk. You are someone who cares about doing the right thing.

What does Jamf do?

Jamf extends the legendary Apple experience people enjoy in their personal lives to the workplace. We believe the experience of using a device at work or school should feel the same, and be as secure as, using a personal device. With Jamf, IT and security teams are able to confidently manage and protect Mac, iPad, iPhone and Apple TV devices, easing the burden of updating, deploying and securing the data used by their end-users. Jamf’s purpose is to simplify work by helping organizations manage and secure an Apple experience that end-users love and organizations trust.

We are free-thinkers, can-doers and problem crushers with a passion for helping customers empower their workforce to focus on their jobs, not the hassles of managing technology – freeing nurses to care, teachers to teach and businesses to thrive. We have over 2,500 employees worldwide who are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work each and every day.

Get social with us and follow the conversation at #OneJamf

About the job
Are you looking for a hybrid or remote work opportunity? Are you interested in a workplace that allows for flexibility in your day? Are you ready for a workplace that provides benefits that suit your needs?

Are you interested in a workplace that allows for flexibility in your day?

As a Software Engineer Intern, your primary mission will be to help design, write, and deploy new implementations for the tools that guide Relativity. You will use your technical expertise to help the team design and write enhancements for the Relativity platform. You will report to the appropriate Engineering Manager.

We offer a 3-month, paid, full-time Summer Internship starting in July 2023 (or earlier). Your success will provide you with knowledge of software development and open many opportunities within our organization and beyond!

Your Role in Action

Use new Cloud technologies and popular programming language (C#, .NET, .NET Core, Visual Studio, Microsoft SQL Server, Azure, Docker, Kubernetes) to build and test our web-based litigation support platform
Work on scalable and dynamic web system which supports integration with multiple search engines, clustering, technologies, and client component interaction through web services
Learn how to build distributable systems composed of multiple databases, processing, and web servers.
Participate in the SCRUM process
Troubleshoot issues

Your Skills

Current student, pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Math or related area of study
Experience with and a passion for web development
Desire to work the Agile development methodology
Team player

Relativity is a diverse workplace with different skills and life experiences—and we love and celebrate those differences. We believe that employees are happiest when they're empowered to be their full, authentic selves, regardless how you identify.

Benefit Highlights

Comprehensive health plan

Flexible work arrangements

Two, week-long company breaks per year

Unlimited time off

Long-term incentive program

Training investment program

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

About the job
Working at Horizon is more than a job – it’s personal. For us, success is measured by the numbers that matter most – the number of lives we touch, the number we change and those we work tirelessly to help save. We’re a team of agile, out-of-the-box thinkers who are inspired to do more because we know we’re a part of something bigger. We strive to build meaningful careers at a company whose values we share because when we live up to our potential, we help others live up to theirs.

Position Summary:

The purpose of the role is to provide Automation and Equipment engineering support to site systems and process equipment and to ensure they are operated, improved and maintained to meet Customer and compliance requirements.

Responsibilities:

Automation systems

Facilitate internal resources and outside vendors in developing technical solutions for automated equipment.
Interface with equipment vendors to ensure successful equipment delivery, integration and validation.
Maintain PLC automation systems in a validated state in compliance with site change control.
Understand the requirements of computer systems validation and ensure compliance is maintained.
Act as operations support for Fill Finish and Biologics Tech Development.
Interface with Operations, IT, QS and QA groups to successfully validate software systems and adherence to life cycle management and system maintenance
Provide automation requirements and implement solutions for new products and/or capacity expansions
Support disaster recovery and back up procedures and processes to ensure business impact is minimized in the event of a failure.
Provide technical and automation core competency support, including possible off-hours, remote and onsite coverage. This also includes operations / engineering training on basic troubleshooting
Management of Automation vendors during equipment troubleshooting and upgrade activities.

Horizon Core Values & Competencies:

Growth

Manages Ambiguity
Strategic Mindset
Demonstrates Self-awareness
Cultivates Innovation
Develops Talent

Accountability

Drives Results
Ensures Accountability
Decision Quality

Transparency

Courage
Collaboration
Instills Trust

Horizon Therapeutics plc is an equal opportunity employer. Horizon will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to any characteristic protected by applicable law.

About the job
We are supporting a Medical Device manufacturer that produces pacemakers based in Germany, looking for hands on R&D Engineers to join their team.

Job profile
Interpretation and implementation of company strategy within the R&D team
Support on the optimisation of the R&D processes
Initiation and support of research projects with universities
Setup and implementation of CFD simulation method in the company
Steering committee member within MDD re-certification and MDR certification
Support root cause analysis within CAPA and NC processes
Support on analysis of post market surveillance data
Cooperation and communication with interface departments, eg. Regulatory, Risk Management, Quality, Life Cycle Engineering, Production
SME within FDA/MDD/MDSAP Audits

Requirements:
4 Years in R&D in an Active Medical Device company
MDR knowledge
Willing to travel (40%)
Fluent German and English

About the job
Estamos procurando graduados em engenharia dinâmicos e excepcionais para ingressar em nosso programa de pós-graduação a partir de setembro de 2023. Somos uma empresa voltada para o futuro com o desejo de permanecer inovadora e sustentável em um mercado cada vez mais global. Estamos à procura de comunicadores altamente motivados, emocionalmente inteligentes, trabalhadores e articulados como você para nos ajudar a alcançar nossas aspirações de crescimento.


Quem são DS Smith?

Somos o fornecedor líder de soluções de embalagem e o maior reciclador da Europa. Temos uma estratégia única de ciclo de fornecimento com uma abordagem líder da indústria para a sustentabilidade: queremos as novas ideias mais brilhantes para melhorar continuamente nosso design, inovação e empreendedorismo. É aí que você entra; cada função na DS Smith contribui para nos ajudar a reduzir essa pegada de carbono.

Localizações
Dentro do nosso Programa de Pós-Graduação em Engenharia para 2023, estamos oferecendo oportunidades nos seguintes locais*:

Esmoriz


*Os locais podem mudar dependendo dos requisitos.
Para obter o melhor do programa, exigimos que os candidatos sejam totalmente
móveis.

Sobre o programa

Nosso esquema dura dois anos e dará aos graduados as bases para ter sucesso em Engenharia com diferentes colocações ao longo do programa. Você seguirá um programa de desenvolvimento rigoroso para obter as habilidades necessárias para ter sucesso nessas áreas, ao mesmo tempo em que o desenvolve para se tornar um futuro líder da DS Smith. Você será emparelhado com um mentor e receberá treinamento de primeira classe de nosso parceiro externo para desenvolver capacidades de liderança e oportunidades para colocar tudo o que aprendeu em prática.

Dentro da Engenharia, você terá estágios em manutenção (onde garantimos que nossas máquinas estejam sempre funcionando e mantendo nossa fábrica fluindo) e processo (onde você verá como maximizamos o desempenho de nossas máquinas para aumentar a velocidade enquanto reduzimos custos e desperdícios Você também fará um estágio de Melhoria Contínua, onde revisará todos os nossos processos para determinar onde podemos ser mais eficazes e reduzir o desperdício em nossa missão de ser a empresa de embalagens mais sustentável.

Suas colocações ocorrerão em nossos negócios de Embalagem ou Papel. Nossa equipe de soluções de embalagem fornece soluções de embalagem sustentáveis, que consideram todo o ciclo de fornecimento e dão suporte a algumas das maiores marcas do mundo. Enquanto nosso negócio de papel fabrica materiais sustentáveis para caixas de papelão ondulado, papéis especiais e papéis de alto desempenho para a produção de embalagens. Seja qual for o seu negócio, você desempenhará um papel fundamental no desenvolvimento de estratégias sob medida e fornecerá um produto sustentável de alta qualidade.

Juntamente com as habilidades específicas da função que você desenvolverá, você fará parte de um grupo de graduados e, juntos, ofereceremos um programa de desenvolvimento de classe mundial que o ajudará a se tornar um de nossos futuros líderes.

· No primeiro ano, o foco é compreender a si mesmo; suas habilidades, seus pontos fortes e como realizar seu potencial.

· No segundo ano, seu desenvolvimento será sobre a compreensão dos outros, como trabalhar de forma eficaz em equipes e como apoiar os outros.

Você será responsável por sua própria carreira, quer se torne um líder ou um especialista, nós o ajudaremos a encontrar a casa perfeita na DS Smith.



Sobre você

Para ser considerado para este esquema você deve ter no mínimo:
· Formado em Engenharia.

· Falar fluentemente em Português e Inglês.

· Ter o direito de trabalhar em Portugal.
Benefícios

Um salário competitivo.
Uma série de outros benefícios, dependendo do país em que você está se candidatando.


*Os Centros de Avaliação ocorrerão em março/abril de 2023 e os candidatos deverão poder comparecer virtualmente.

**Os candidatos aprovados precisarão estar disponíveis para iniciar sua primeira colocação em 4 de setembro de 2023.

About the job
Kehittäjä/ Integraatioasiantuntija

Front AI Oy on vahvasti kasvava ja kansainvälistyvä yhtiö, jonka palveluksessa on yli 20 henkilöä Suomessa, Ruotsissa ja Tanskassa. Olemme alan premium-toimittaja tekoälyn käytössä asiakaspalvelun tukena. Toimitamme asiakkaille ratkaisuja tukeutuen sekä omiin että muiden kehittämiin teknologioihin.

Haemme nyt joukkoomme kehittäjää/integraatioasiantuntijaa. Kehittäjän roolissa työskentelet Front AI:n omien tuotteiden parissa, joilla valloitamme maailman. Integraatioasiantuntijan roolissa varmistat, että toimittamamme ratkaisun eri palaset keskustelevat keskenään järkevästi, luotettavasti ja ylläpidettävästi. Ennen kaikkea olet IT-alan generalisti, joka tarttuu pelotta mihin tahansa tehtävään ja opiskelee sen, mitä ei vielä osaa.

Teknologiatiimimme on vielä pieni, mutta kasvussa, ja meillä pääset myös vaikuttamaan siihen, miten töitä tehdään. Tavoitteenamme on rento ja avoin työympäristö, jossa sekä yksilöiden että tiimin kehitykseen panostetaan.

Työpaikkana voit käyttää toimistoamme Ruoholahdessa, mutta töitä on myös mahdollista tehdä vaikka 100 % etänä.

Haemme ensisijaisesti henkilöä, jolla on jo muutaman vuoden työkokemus. Tästä voidaan joustaa, jos sinulla on tarpeeksi muuta näyttöä osaamisesta kuten omia projekteja.

Mitä odotamme sinulta:
• Soveltuva IT-alan tutkinto tai vastaava määrä käytännön kokemusta
• Kokemusta B2B-asiakasrajapinnassa toimimisesta
• Sujuvaa suomen ja englannin kielen taitoa

Tärkeimmät teknologiset osa-alueet, joiden parissa teet töitä:
• Node.js
• AWS, Azure
• Web-devaus

Jos sinulta löytyy osaamista, voit päästä työskentelemään myös näiden parissa:
• DevOps, CI/CD
• React
• Web-maailman lait ja standardit (GDPR, saavutettavuus yms.)
• UI/UX suunnittelu

Yleistä:
• Etätyö/Hybridityö Helsingissä
• Työaika joustava
• Kattavat työsuhde-edut
• Vakituinen työsuhde
Kiinnostuitko?
Voit lähettää hakemuksesi ja CV:si palkkatoivomuksineen sähköpostiin techjobs@front.ai. Paikka täytetään heti sopivan henkilön löydyttyä, joten älä aikaile! Lisätietoja tehtävästä saat laittamalla meiliä CTO Tomi Päiväniemelle, tomi.paivaniemi@front.ai.

Tunnetko henkilön, jota tämä voisi kiinnostaa? Meillä on tilaa useammalle työntekijälle, joten voit vapaasti jakaa tämän verkostosi kanssa!

About the job
Persönliche Entfaltung in der BI Welt von morgen!

Unserem Leitspruch «experience the sense of tomorrow» verpflichtet unterstützen wir zukunftsorientierte Kunden dabei, aus der Vielzahl ihrer Daten businessrelevante Informationen zu visualisieren und zuverlässige Unternehmenssteuerung in ein erfolgreiches Morgen zu ermöglichen. Wir bieten Dir eine vielseitige Herausforderung in einem professionellen und marketingorientierten Unternehmen an, welches die Digitalisierung vorantreibt und Dir die optimale Basis für eine zukunftsorientierte Entwicklung im Consulting ermöglicht. Bei uns kannst du visionär mitgestalten mit viel Eigenverantwortung in einem motivierenden und abwechslungsreichen Arbeitsumfeld. Du arbeitest in abwechslungsreichen Business Intelligence Projekten bei namhaften Kunden in verschiedensten Branchen. Deine Begeisterung für Daten, Selbständigkeit und Berufsstolz sind bereits gute Voraussetzungen, um mit uns ins Gespräch zu kommen.

Innerhalb unserer Wachstumsstrategie suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine hochmotivierte und engagierte Persönlichkeit für unseren Standort in Deutschland. Der Arbeitsort ist flexibel und grösstenteils arbeiten wir in Deutschland remote, es sollte aber eine gewisse Reisebereitschaft vorhanden sein.

Deine Aufgaben

Beratung von Kunden in vielfältigen BI-Themen im Zusammenspiel mit verschiedenen Quell- und Umsystemen
Unterstützung unseres Sales Teams bei der Gewinnung von Neukunden und dem nachhaltigen Ausbau unseres Kundenstamms
Mit Deinem koordinierten Vorgehen ermittelst Du den Informationsbedarf aus der Sicht unserer Kunden und bist entweder verantwortlich für die Beratung, Konzeptionierung, Planung, Entwicklung sowie der nachhaltigen Betreuung von BI- und Datawarehouse Lösungen auf der Basis von Microsoft Power Plattform und Data Integration (SQL-Server, Synapse, SSIS etc.) on Premises, Azure oder in HybridClouds oder von BI-Lösungen auf der Basis von Qlik und Jedox
Selbständige Durchführung von Projekten und Koordination mit dem Kunden

Dein Profil

Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium in der Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Erfahrung im Datawarehouse- und BI-Umfeld mit Microsoft Produkten insbesondere Power-BI und Synapse oder Erfahrung mit Qlik
Du verstehst Daten und sprichst SQL
Vorkenntnisse im Bereich SAP BI, SAP BW etc. sind ein Plus
Du hast eine hohe Kundenorientierung, gehst Herausforderungen gezielt an und es macht Dir Spass Projekte lösungs- und budgetorientiert mit und für Kunden umzusetzen
Du fühlst Dich wohl dabei, eine hohe Kommunikationskultur innerhalb von Projekten und Kundenbeziehungen zu etablieren
Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Reisebereitschaft innerhalb von Deutschland und der Schweiz

Unser Angebot
Eine vielseitige Herausforderung in einem spannenden, modernen Spielfeld und einem starken, erfahrenen Team. Es erwarten Dich ein moderner Arbeitsplatz, flexible Arbeitsbedingungen, spannende und herausfordernde Projekte. Bei uns kannst Du etwas bewegen!

Bist Du unsere Verstärkung? Dann bewirb Dich jetzt, wir freuen uns, Dich kennenzulernen.

company_name: TST Poland Sp Z o o
description:
About the job
Requariements

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline

5+ years of applicable engineering experience

Strong proficiency in Python with an emphasis in building data pipelines

Ability to write complex SQL to perform common types of analysis and aggregations

Experience with Apache Airflow or Google Composer

Detail-oriented and document all the work

Ability to work with others from diverse skill-sets and backgrounds

GCP solution architect - certified

Experience in GCP, Big Query

Working experience in Databricks, Spark is expected

About the job
The global financial ecosystem is changing. Revolutionary blockchain technology has unlocked the potential for people around the world to have more equal access to wealth and information. This transformation has begun with the mass global adoption of cryptocurrencies but like all new financial systems, it needs greater trust to realize its full potential and remain safe from bad actors. That’s where we come in. The Chainalysis blockchain data platform enables businesses, governments, and banks to solve the world’s most high-profile criminal cases, paving the way for an economy built on blockchains.

The global financial ecosystem is changing. Revolutionary blockchain technology has unlocked the potential for people around the world to have more equal access to wealth and information. This transformation has begun with the mass global adoption of cryptocurrencies but like all new financial systems, it needs greater trust to realize its full potential and remain safe from bad actors. That’s where we come in. The Chainalysis blockchain data platform enables businesses, governments, and banks to solve the world’s most high-profile criminal cases, paving the way for an economy built on blockchains.

Software Engineers in the data platform and clustering teams strike a balance between forward-looking software engineering best practices, and data engineering infrastructure know-how. This team partners with data scientists, research and product teams, helping architect, create and maintain data pipelines. Software Engineers in the data platform and Clustering teams have a deep understanding of blockchain data, are experts at understanding protocol schemas and nuances, build scalable AWS ingest pipelines, lambdas and services. We measure success by the coverage of data clustered for the various Chainalysis products.

In one year you’ll know you were successful if…

Built scalable ETL/ELT pipelines for clustering
Created tools to apply different attributes and heuristics to clustering
Worked with our product teams to ensure accurate data is provided to our customers
Increased coverage of clustering
Contributed to the effectiveness and velocity of team deliverables
You have learned new technologies and shown that you are not afraid to work outside your comfort zone

A Background Like This Helps

Solid understanding of building data pipelines, lakes and streaming services
Some work experience with AWS tools such as S3, Lambdas, and CDKs
Experience with running batch and streaming based ETL/ELT pipelines in production
Understanding of efficient data structures, algorithms and computational complexity
Planned, built, and owned production systems
Experience with Python, Java, and/or Typescript
The versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job
The ability to clearly communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences
Bias for action

The Following Would Differentiate You

Experience with cloud environments (AWS, GCP, etc)
Knowledge of blockchain technologies and protocols

At Chainalysis, we help government agencies, cryptocurrency businesses, and financial institutions track and investigate illicit activity on the blockchain, allowing them to engage confidently with cryptocurrency. We take care of our people with great benefits, professional development opportunities, and fun.

You belong here.

At Chainalysis, we believe that diversity of experience and thought makes us stronger. With both customers and employees around the world, we are committed to ensuring our team reflects the unique communities around us. Some of the ways we’re ensuring we keep learning are an internal Diversity Committee, Days of Reflection throughout the year including International Women’s Day, Harvey Milk Day, World Humanitarian Day, and UN International Migrants Day, and a commitment to continue revisiting and reevaluating our diversity culture.

We encourage applicants across any race, ethnicity, gender/gender expression, age, spirituality, ability, experience and more. Additionally, if you need any accommodations to make our interview process more accessible to you due to a disability, don't hesitate to let us know. You can learn more here. We can’t wait to meet you.

Applying from the EU? Please review our Chainalysis Applicant Privacy Policy.

By submitting this application, I consent to and authorize Chainalysis to contact my former employers, and any and all other persons and organizations for information bearing upon my qualifications for employment. I further authorize the listed employers, schools and personal references to give Chainalysis (without further notice to me) any and all information about my previous employment and education, along with other pertinent information they may have, and hereby waive any actions which I may have against either party(ies) for providing a reference. I understand any future employment will be contingent on the Company receiving satisfactory employment references.

job_title: Software Engineer Data Presentation - Remote Germany
description:
About the job
Headquartered in New York City, Dataiku was founded in Paris in 2013 and achieved unicorn status in 2019. Now, more than 1,000+ employees work across the globe in our offices and remotely. Backed by a renowned set of investors and partners including CapitalG, Tiger Global, and ICONIQ Growth, we’ve set out to build the future of AI.

Data visualization is often the most striking (and for some, the most accessible) part of the data-to-insights process. Let’s face it — there’s nothing more exciting than beautiful fit-for-purpose data viz.

We are looking for a talented software engineer to create usable, intuitive, beautiful interfaces and scalable engines for Dataiku DSS. Dataiku DSS brings together big data and AI technologies into a unique and easy-to-use platform. It allows data scientists to process data with SQL databases, Spark, and Kubernetes with either user-friendly interfaces or code. The same platform also allows business analysts to create powerful machines or deep learning models with just a few clicks.

What We Do

We design and code experiences that resonate with our growing customer base. We empower non-technical users with user-friendly and well-thought tools to let them quickly and efficiently visualize, analyze, or process their data. Our current technical stack is based on Javascript, AngularJS, Angular, and D3.js on the frontend (we only support the latest versions of Chrome and Firefox!). We develop using Java, Spring, and Python on the backend.

What You Will Do

With your top-tier teammates from the engineering team and the help of the UX team, you will:

Build the components that allow Dataiku DSS users to create and display charts, dashboards, and ad-hoc web applications in a scalable way (both frontend and backend).
Prototype and create new ways to interact with data or integrations with other products such as Tableau, PowerBI, Salesforce, Slack, etc.
Work closely with product managers and UX designers to brainstorm on new features and iteratively refine solutions.
Shape a safe place to work where all ideas and suggestions are welcome and taken into account, and where we all know everyone does their best.
Write high-quality code, as your teammates do!
You are the ideal recruit if:

You have experience in software development and you are interested in data visualization tools.
You are customer-oriented — you want to understand customer needs and how the product is used.
You are at ease with both frontend and backend development, or you’ve mastered frontend development but are not afraid to dive into backend code to better understand how it works.
You know that a chart is worth a thousand grid cells.
You have firsthand experience (either professional or personal) building a real product.
You blink each time you see a misaligned pixel!
You are humble and kind. You don't hesitate to ask questions when you don't know, and you treat your colleagues with respect, kindness, and honesty.
Dataiku’s culture is right for you if:

You want to be able to define your own version of work-life balance - flexible is our go-to word, it applies equally to remote work, vacations and parental benefits
You need autonomy to thrive - we trust our people, give them space to do their best and stay away from artificial deadlines
You enjoy spending time with your colleagues and learning from your peers - meet for Friday universities, annual offsites, virtual trivia nights and more
You like feeling cared about - watch out for the magical Christmas box delivered at home and an unforgettable onboarding week
You care about giving back - it’s what our Ikig.AI program is all about: Dataikers are encouraged to work pro bono for one or several nonprofits of their choosing

If you want to learn more about our hiring process, you can read this article about our engineering hiring philosophy .

About Dataiku

Dataiku is the platform for Everyday AI, systemizing the use of data for exceptional business results. By making the use of data and AI an everyday behavior, Dataiku unlocks the creativity within individual employees to power collective success at companies of all sizes and across all industries. Don’t get us wrong: we are a tech company building software. Our culture is even pretty geeky! But our driving force is and will always remain people, starting with ours. We consider our employees to be our most precious asset, and we are committed to ensuring that each of them gets the most rewarding, enjoyable, and memorable work experience with us. Fly over to Instagram to learn more about our #dataikulife.

Our practices are rooted in the idea that everyone should be treated with dignity, decency and fairness. Dataiku also believes that a diverse identity is a source of strength and allows us to optimize across the many dimensions that are needed for our success. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment practices are based on business needs, without regard to race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, veteran status or any other aspect which makes an individual unique or protected by laws and regulations in the locations where we operate. This applies to all policies and procedures related to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, performance, promotion and termination and all other conditions and terms of employment. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please contact us at: reasonable-accommodations@dataiku.com

About the job
Are you looking to be in a workplace where colleagues inspire one another? Are you interested in competitive and impactful benefits? Do you prefer flexible work arrangements?

At Relativity we make software to help users organize data, discover the truth, and act on it. Our e-discovery platform is used by more than 13,000 organizations around the world to manage large volumes of data and quickly identify key issues during litigation, internal investigations, and compliance projects.

The Product Management team is looking for a Product Manager with background in product lifecycle, technical acumen and agile practices, as well as, strong communication and collaboration skills. You will be responsible for participating and leading both discovery and development to achieve a specific product goal. A successful candidate must be energized by building deep customer empathy, collaborating with design and development, optimizing team processes, and utilizing data to monitor project success.

Focused on Relativity Platform you will be responsible for helping create creative solutions to enable API development, user authentication, service and application management, component infrastructure and other core functions related to a large commercial software application being deployed in the cloud. As a member of the Platform group, you will use modern software creation methodologies to release these features, supporting the success of the Relativity product and our developer community.

You will represent the portfolio at conferences and speaking engagements as an expert in the field. You will help lead a team of skilled PMs focused creating exceptional user experiences and actualizing the vision and strategy you lay forth.

Responsibilities

Deeply understands the product. Speaks to our technical implementation in a way that internal stakeholders and clients can understand.
Ability to speak to the variety of workflows and end user needs we see across segments and personas and coaches others on how to do the same.
Owns product roadmap and backlog for their product(s).
Works directly with Product Leads to help build a strategy and goals for their product(s).
Develops and shares plans and results clearly to immediate teams.
Ensure what we build solves the customer or business problem and delivers a product that is stable in production and satisfies scalability, reliability, performance and business goals.
Organize and engage in usability testing to define detailed Interaction flows.
Meet with users and stakeholders to obtain deep understanding of detailed needs and constraints.
Anticipates the need to bring cross-functional teams together to solve problems.
Provides recommendations rooted in customer empathy.
Responsible for user and competitive research for their product(s)
Self-directed analysis and data interpretation.
Tracks and reports on product metrics.
Develops external and internal facing go-to-market content
Ability to break down large projects into iterative releases
Translate validated designs and analysis into story cards with acceptance criteria.
Ability to prioritize work based on impact.
Test new features to ensure quality for release
Manage defect prioritization
Understands technical requirements for completion of new initiatives and ensures development team is set up for success.
Operates as an indirect leader, facilitating communication across internal stakeholders and effectively communicate ‘why’ and gain buy in. Also responsible for driving conflict resolution amongst product development stakeholders.
Provides direct feedback to peers and is skilled at understanding multiple points of view.

Preferred Qualifications

Generates excitement and curiosity when working with highly complex systems.
Is a team player with proven ability to deliver features from inception to delivery.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Detail-oriented, enthusiastic self-starter with ability to work both independently and in a team environment.
Has the technical acumen necessary to understand core functions of our e-discovery system and to understand technical challenges and make educated trade-offs with the development team
Strong project manager able to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong facilitation and analysis skills.
Strong business acumen.

Minimum Qualifications

4+ years of experience in product management at a technology company.
Solid understanding of software development lifecycle and agile methodologies.
Knowledge and experience doing discovery & usability testing to gather customer feedback.

Relativity is a diverse workplace with different skills and life experiences—and we love and celebrate those differences. We believe that employees are happiest when they're empowered to be their full, authentic selves, regardless how you identify.

Benefit Highlights

Comprehensive health, dental, and vision plans

Parental leave for primary and secondary caregivers

Flexible work arrangements

Two, week-long company breaks per year

Unlimited time off

Long-term incentive program

Training investment program

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

About the job
About Revolut
People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.
As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.
About The Role
We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘
We’re looking for a superstar Data Analysts who do not believe there is a data task that can be too hard 🦬 From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ✨
Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇
What You’ll Be Doing
Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Developing documentation and data governance
Owning the entire ETL process
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Providing clean data sets to end users, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions
What You'll Need
Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
Strong background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge
Nice to have
Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++…)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming
Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.
By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

About the job
Ort / Branche

Nürnberg/ remote - IT-Dienstleistung

Hast Du Lust auf spannende und vielfältige Projekte, die Du mitgestalten kannst? Hast Du zudem Spaß im Umgang mit Menschen und der Entwicklung von komplexen Architekturen und Lösungen? Dann werde Teil von uns.

Höchste Qualität und Partnerschaft auf Augenhöhe – darauf setzen wir bei Cegeka. Denn kurzfristige Erfolge sind zwar wichtig, aber nicht das, worauf es uns als Familienunternehmen mit über 25-jähriger Geschichte ankommt. Mit mehr als 6.000 Mitarbeiter/-innen in elf europäischen Ländern identifizieren und erschließen wir die Potenziale neuer Technologien, ohne uns von Hypes blenden zu lassen, und entwickeln maßgeschneiderte Lösungen, die unsere Kunden den entscheidenden Schritt voranbringen.

Beginn / Dauer

Ab sofort / unbefristet

Aufgaben
Du setzt spannende Projekte um und schaffst zusammen mit Deinem Team Innovationen, die unseren Kunden das Leben erleichtern.
Du arbeitest während der gesamten Softwareentwicklung nach agilen Methoden wie Scrum oder Kanban, stellst die Qualität der Software sicher und sammelst Deine Erfahrung vorrangig durch Learning-by-Doing - ein erfahrener Kollege (m/w/d) begleitet Dich dabei.
Von Anfang an bekommst Du verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben in den Bereichen: Design, Modellierung, Implementierung und Dokumentation von komplexen Anwendungen.
Du findest heraus was Du am besten kannst, indem Du unterschiedliche Rollen im Team, sowie in der Entwicklung übernimmst und somit Deine eigenen Schwerpunkte setzt.
Bei uns agierst Du nicht nur hinter den Kulissen, sondern bist von Anfang an Teil unseres Teams und kannst direkt Deine Fähigkeiten einsetzen, um unsere Kunden glücklich zu machen.

Qualifikation
Ob IT-Studium oder Ausbildung, viel wichtiger ist Deine Leidenschaft für die Softwareentwicklung.
Du bringst mindestens ein Jahr Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung mit.
Java ist für Dich mehr als nur eine Insel.
Idealerweise verfügst Du über Kenntnisse in den Bereichen: REST, Spring Boot, HTML5 und Angular 2+/React.
Du arbeitest gern im Team, stehst mit klarer Kommunikation nicht auf Kriegsfuß, bist kreativ, engagiert und bereit Neues zu lernen.
Außerdem sprichst Du sehr gut Deutsch und gutes Englisch. Kurz: Du bist der ideale Kandidat für uns.

Unser Angebot

Was du allerdings sicher noch nicht weißt, ist: Warum Du bei uns arbeiten solltest:
Du stehst bei uns im Mittelpunkt.
Deine Meinung wird gehört und Du kannst vieles selbst beeinflussen.
Wir bieten Dir den Freiraum, den Du brauchst, um Deine Arbeit richtig gut zu machen.
Dafür interessieren wir uns nicht nur für Deine Stärken, sondern auch für Deine Schwächen um sie zusammen mit Dir anzugehen.
Denn wir wollen Dir jeden Tag die Möglichkeit geben, Dich weiterzuentwickeln. In die Richtung, die Dir am besten gefällt.

Hard Facts:
We care about you! Dein Arbeitsort ist freiwählbar – Ob im Büro oder Remote, wir bieten Dir ein hohes Maß an Flexibilität.
Standortnaher Einsatz in Nürnberg.
„Duz“-Kultur.
Großes Unternehmen aber Start-Up-Feeling in Nürnberg.
Flache Hierarchien und kurze Entscheidungswege.
Eigenes Budget für Weiterbildungen, welches Du selbst verwalten kannst.
Freie Wahl Deines Notebooks und Deines Smartphones.
Ein dynamisches Team und eine flexible Arbeitsumgebung mit modernsten Technologien.
Regelmäßige Fortbildungen und Zertifizierungen, damit Du immer up-to-date bist.
Ein unbefristetes Arbeitsverhältnis mit spannenden Aufgaben.
Individuelle Arbeitszeitmodelle nach Deinen Bedürfnissen für eine dauerhaft ausgeglichene Work-Life-Balance.
Eine ausgeprägte Open-Door-Mentalität, in der neue Ideen gerne gehört werden.
Attraktive Prämienprogramme für gute Arbeit, gute Ideen und Deine eigenen Projekte

Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt?

Dann lass‘ uns herausfinden, wohin unsere gemeinsame Reise gehen soll. Melde Dich dafür einfach bei Habibe.

Habibe Ali, HR Ansprechpartnerin am Nürnberger Standort, verrät Dir, warum Cegeka vielleicht auch Dein perfekter Arbeitgeber wäre.

Hier das Video dazu: Warum Cegeka?

Kontakt

Cegeka Deutschland GmbH

Habibe Ali

Tullnaustraße 20

90402 Nürnberg

Tel +49 911 43453 512

Mobil +49 170 7904751

Email Habibe.Ali@cegeka.com

Wir möchten Dich selbstverständlich auch in Corona-Zeiten persönlich kennenlernen. Aber uns liegen die Gesundheit und das Wohlergehen aller sehr am Herzen. Daher möchten wir Dir hier unsere wichtigsten Regeln im Rahmen des Bewerbungsprozesses nennen.

industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
About the job
About Us

Avea is a Swiss longevity startup with the vision to become the leading player in the evidence-based longevity supplement industry. We offer science-based longevity supplements to target multiple hallmarks of aging, allowing individuals to improve their well-being by slowing down aging itself. Our mission is to optimize people's health- and lifespan, helping them keep or regain their vitality to live as healthily as possible for as long as possible.

The Role

As a Performance Marketing Specialist you will be responsible for initiating, executing, and reporting on digital marketing initiatives to drive awareness and conversions. You'll set the strategy, optimise our existing performance channels, test new channels and own the results in our main markets (Europe and APAC).

This is a great opportunity to join a fast pace and mission driven start-up on where you will be exposed to incredible learning and growth opportunities.

Tasks And Responsibilities
Drive our digital performance marketing across all channels e.g Facebook, Google and TikTok
Plan and set up online marketing campaigns in coordination with the Co-Founder in charge of marketing
Monitor performance of individual assets (e.g. pictures, articles, videos), identify what works best and coordinate with the rest of the marketing team to produce more high performance assets and to implement best practices
Measure and analysis campaigns on a daily basis by using Google Analytics, Google data studio, Google Ads Dashboard & Facebook Ads Dashboard, Excel and other dashboards needed.
Identify improvement opportunities in digital performance marketing growth and efficiency by constantly testing ideas with audience targeting, split tests and A/B tests etc.
Test new channels and opportunities

You'll Fit Great With These Skills And Values
University degree, quantitative majors like engineering, physics, mathematics are strongly preferred
Data Driven, you are analytical, like looking at data and derive conclusions from it
Team player who is able to work independently on dynamic work environment that requires own thinking and problem solving
Eager to learn and adopt new tools/technologies as well as share knowledge with others
Very good command of Ms.Excel
You understand online shopping and have collected some experience in optimizing a conversion journey and online customer acquisition
At least 1 year experience in either Google AdWords platform or Facebook Ads Manager, ideally both
Basic understanding of google analytics, certification is a plus
Interest in the longevity industry

Why join us

We believe that the best companies help you live your life the way you want and become the person you want to be. That's why we focus on promoting your personal freedom and growth. Here are some of the benefits you'll enjoy as a member of our team:
Work at a well-funded, early-stage startup in the longevity industry
Be part of a dynamic, high-performing, and fun team
A high degree of personal responsibility, creative freedom and opportunities
Work with the brightest researchers within longevity and with successful and well-known serial entrepreneurs
Fully remote opportunity where you are free to live and work wherever you want
Strong team culture with regular team events and off-sites

For this position previous Experience in Paid Performance (facebook & Google) for E-commerce and in Data Management (preferably Tableau) are needed

About the job
Cyber Security Engineer

€45,300 / R 221,700

Romania (Remote)

Permanent



Do you understand cyber security principles, and strong communication and collaboration skills? Are you a successful problem solving, with an analytical mindset and a desire to learn? Have you worked for 1 year in a cyber security role, and have experience with vulnerability management or threat intelligence systems? This large British Retailer is looking for a Cyber Security Engineer to join their new team in Romania.





Your tasks and responsibilities



Operational Incident and Requests

Major Incident and Incident Management reporting
Maintain operational oversight of all ticketing activity including, but not limited to, security incidents and alerts, tuning recommendations, hunting activities, and ad hoc requests.
Overseeing the daily security operational processes and acting as an escalation point where necessary.
EDR
Knowledge creation


KPI & Reporting

Prepare and deliver content for operational reports and operational status meetings
Prepare, produce, and deliver Weekly, Monthly and Quarterly reporting
Security Awareness content
Learning
Prepare, produce, and deliver any additional Executive reporting required


Strategic

Responsible for delivery of Information Security Roadmap
Responsible for driving change on Continuous Service Improvement planning board
Understanding the developments in security technologies and their applications.
Understanding of industry standard Information Security practices.
Awareness of PCI DSS current version
Listen, understand, challenge, support - identify the most important security factors to focus on, taking into consideration risk, cost, existing capability, and our strategy and roadmap
Promote existing information security services, solutions, and patterns, in line with our security strategy and roadmap, to system owners and domain leads


Auditing and Governance

Review of the Infosec E-learning Packages
Infosec Policies review
Internal ISMS audit
Cyber Insurance renewal
Gambling Commission audit
Third party IS risk assessments
Penetration testing with 3rd parties
Working through our existing vendors and potential new vendors, requesting updated certifications and revised policies ensure they remain up to date.
Responsible for compliance with all Buzz Bingo security governance and controls




Your skills, knowledge, and experience



Essential

Conversant in the latest developments and technologies in the Information Security industry.
Must be degree educated, ideally in an information security or IT related discipline.
Effective leadership, interpersonal and communication skills.
Ability to influence at senior levels on matters relating to security and information risk
Good verbal and written communication skills and able to communicate effectively at all levels
Ability to manage time and priorities appropriately
Understanding of firewalls, proxies, SIEM, antivirus, IDS/IPS and other technical security solution concepts.
Working knowledge of Cloud Security best practices, frameworks and compliance


Desirable

Preferred professional qualifications would include:
ISACA - CISM, CRISC or CISA
Knowledge of Industry compliance standards eg CIS, NIST, PCI etc
Practical experience of operating within the Cyber Essentials Framework
Experience of working in the retail or hospitality industry




The offer

€45,300 Gross Salary
Personal progression
Fully Remote Working




To apply

To apply for the position of Cyber Security Engineer, please send your CV to Teylor Webber via the Apply Now button.

About the job
At Picnic, we’re revolutionizing the way people buy groceries today with our innovative and sustainable modern milkman, app-only concept. We develop a whole new idea in-house, developing cutting-edge technologies and processes to ensure we continue to the rapid growth without missing a beat. If you're up for the challenge of taking Picnic from North Rhine-Westphalia across the whole Germany and help scaling up the modern milkman, then make sure you talk with us!

🥜 In a nutshell

Did you know that...
we are a Dutch company founded in 2015 and active in The Netherlands, Germany and France, counting 1000+ talents in our central offices and more than 17 000 talents in operations across three countries?
we build 25+ tech products in-house and 20+ AI/ML projects like drop times optimization (read here), article demand forecast or personalization on the previously purchased articles?
we operate with a fleet of electric vehicles (read here), build most of our supply chain in-house (read here) and do only next-day delivery that allows us to set up a sustainable supply chain model?
we raised €600M in our Series D round of funding to further build and grow the best milkman on earth?

The role of an In-house Analyst Consultant (listen to our colleagues' testimonials about their role here) at Picnic is versatile and changes based on your team and the projects you are involved in. We have more than 150 Analyst Consultants across all teams and you will be faced with a steep learning curve by working on complex projects, challenge the status-quo and impacting the business model cross-countries. Throughout the process we'll assess which domain suits you best: Commercial, Distribution, Fulfillment, Growth & Acquisition, Product, and Tech. You’ll work with multiple stakeholders from our offices in the Netherlands, Germany, and France and work on optimizing the way we do things today at Picnic.

"I'm currently improving our pricing strategy in an ever changing market. This includes analyzing price differences across regions, stores and products to identify opportunities and work towards a more attractive, competitive and profitable assortment. My day mixes anything from meeting various stakeholders mostly from commercial team to complex analysis with Python, SQL, Tableau", Gertijn Kreijenbroek

🎯 What you’ll do

You’ll work on a wide range of exciting projects, which, depending on your team, can include:
Perform analyses on topics like: our store assortment and products ranking, fleet analytics and capacity modeling, mathematical optimization around our warehouse operations etc.
Develop algorithms and operating procedures to spot damaged products before they leave the warehouse
Demand forecasting: Develop forecasting models to predict future customer demand
Develop cost-benefit analyses to design a scalable cloud infrastructure that fits our automation projects
Onboarding program: Develop gifting and communication strategies to maximize engagement and retention of new customers
Determine the impact of improving our planning and routing algorithms in our supply-chain systems
. . . and many more projects!

Take a look at two of our projects in Strategy & Analytics: Picnic plays it cool: a data-driven cold chain for groceries and Finding Product Alternatives at Picnic!

⭐ About you
Master’s or PhD degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Robotics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Data Science, Physics, Operational Research, Logistics & Supply Chain, or Business Engineering
0-2 years of work experience in a fast-paced environment or experience with projects involving data analytics, statistical modelling, machine learning, mathematical optimization or process simulation
Ability to explain complex analytical concepts in a comprehensible manner to various stakeholders from different fields
Your communication skills allow you to convert abstract plans into digestible information for your team
You have worked with SQL and Python or are excited to learn
Your sharp business sense and conceptual thinking abilities mean you can look beyond the obvious to come up with fresh and innovative ideas

You're still wondering if this is the right role for you and you'd like to hear more about the role? Send an e-mail with your CV to our recruiter Lina ( lina.losse@teampicnic.com) and ask her for a short call together in order to get more insights before actually applying. (Please make sure that you fit the requirements in the "About you" section and that we can only count applications via the form below as valid).

📖 Picnic Perks

Every expert was once a beginner!

You’ll get plenty of opportunities to challenge yourself and grow, including the Picnic Tech Academy, Lunch & Learn sessions, and tailored soft skills training. We also offer free professional weekly language courses.

Make a difference

You’ll work in an awesome scale-up environment with the freedom to drive your own projects and create a visible impact. Our fully electric vehicles and sustainable business model mean you’ll also be contributing to making the world a better place!

Teamwork makes the dream work

With more than 80 nationalities across 3 countries, you’ll be part of a diverse company with plenty of cool stuff to get involved with, from board game evenings to after-work drinks to our company ski trip and more!

You Are What You Eat

You’ll get freshly prepared, healthy lunches, as well as snacks and drinks—enjoy!

Stay healthy

Mental health is important. As well as having the option to speak with Picnic colleagues who act as confidential advisors, our collaboration with OpenUp gives you easy access to professional psychologists, along with workshops and materials. There are plenty of sports communities and events to get involved with, from tennis to yoga to climbing!

Attractive package

We offer competitive compensation and a pension plan that looks out for your future self.

Work-life balance

Where possible, we like to enable people to work in ways that suit their working styles, which is why we have a hybrid-working model. Our teams generally like to have at least one team day per week at the office (the tasty lunch may be a factor), but besides that, it’s up to you and your team.

Benefits For Expats

It can be daunting starting a new job AND moving to a new country. That’s why we offer lots of support for our many expat colleagues, including:
Relocation package: If you join Picnic from abroad, we’ll cover your trip to Düsseldorf, sponsor your Visa, and offer you a month of accommodation while you settle in (as long as regulations allow)
From health insurance to living arrangements to pet passports, there are always colleagues who’ve faced the same challenges and are more than happy to help!

Commitment to equal opportunities

Picnic is an equal opportunity employer—this means that all decisions regarding applications will be based on qualifications and merit. Applicants will be regarded independently of age, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, ethnicity, skin color, civil status, religious beliefs, physical or mental disability, or any other factors protected by law.

At Picnic, we celebrate and value our differences and are committed to building a safe and inclusive working environment where everyone can be themselves.

About the job
Company Overview

At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with safety. It’s the constant that empowers people to confidently move forward. It can fill a flight or sell out a stadium. It can care for a patient or graduate a class.

As a global leader in public safety and enterprise security, we create and connect the technologies that help to keep people safe where they live, learn, work and play. Our integrated technology ecosystem unifies critical communications, video security and access control, and command center software, enabling collaboration in more powerful ways.

At Motorola Solutions, we’re ushering in a new era in public safety and security. Bring your passion, potential and talents to a career that matters.

Department Overview

Motorola Solutions provides trusted security solutions to the global market through its Video Security and Access Control Division. Motorola Solutions designs develop and manufactures video analytics, network video management software and hardware, surveillance cameras, and access control solutions. Motorola’s solutions have been installed at thousands of customer sites, including school campuses, transportation systems, healthcare centers, public venues, critical infrastructure, prisons, factories, casinos, airports, financial institutions, government facilities, and retailers.

Job Description

As a member of the Sales Engineering Department, the Sales Engineer will work closely with the Sales Organization to develop and position solutions involving Motorola Solutions products.

The Sales Engineer is responsible for technical aspects of the sales process and works closely with the Sales Department involved to develop and position solutions involving Video Security & Access control Division products, writing specs for tenders, also answering to tenders, driving product tests and complex scenarios and internal/external training among others.

During the needs analysis process, confirm that the products meet the prospect’s requirements and assist in technical qualifications. Throughout the proposal process, articulate the technology and demonstrate Motorola’s solutions to both business and technical users. Position Motorola products relative to competition and formulate system designs that conform to both technical and budgetary requirements.

As this is an international position, international travelling may be required.

Your key responsibilities will include:
Effectively disseminate product knowledge by providing thorough training to Sales Teams when required.
Manufacturing Representatives, Integrators, and End-Users
Support Sales Teams in responding to RFP’s and designing, specifying, and quoting systems
Develop and maintain strong relationships with Sales Teams, customers, and partners
Collaborate with the Technical Support team in providing post-sales support to customers
Have positive attitude and can properly manage time and tasks
Perform related duties as assigned
Validate from a technical point of view any quote delivered by ISR team.
Onsite activities including international travelling when required.

Basic Requirements
5+ years’ experience in Sales Engineering for a technology company
Strong understanding of the video surveillance, body worn cameras and access control market
Self-motivated and focused individual with a passion for technology and an aptitude for customer satisfaction
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in:
English
Excellent presentation skills, especially with remote technologies such as teleconference.
Possesses strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
Has a pleasant, friendly style of verbal and written communication
Driving License and Car are a must.

Technical:
Intimate knowledge and experience with Windows troubleshooting tools and techniques
Excellent knowledge of networking principles and IP communication
Experience with computer hardware configuration and troubleshooting
Experience with network equipment configuration and troubleshooting

Preference will be given to candidates with the following skills and experience:
Experience in access control
College degree or diploma of technology
Prior experience in surveillance industry
Microsoft and/or Cisco certifications
Certification for any competitive products

Travel Requirements

Relocation Provided

Position Type

Referral Payment Plan

No

About the job
THE SCOPE

With 30 years of history, today Gaming1 is one of the international leaders in both land-based and online games of chance (casino games, sports betting and poker). Its evolution at the heart of innovation is accompanied by a diversification and specialization of positions, with the creation of new cutting-edge jobs. As part of its sustained growth, Gaming1 is looking for a Software Engineer in Test Automation to join its QC team.

As a Software Engineer in test automation, you will be part of the QC center that is in charge of testing the things we carry out. You will be part of a close-knit team made up of people with different skills.

You will provide support within our product teams that use an agile working method.

The team wants to welcome a new developer to be responsible for developing new automated tests. You will work independently on technical questions relating to development while communicating closely with your team members and collaborating with other teams.

YOUR ROLE
Continuously develop and maintain the test and analysis tools
Create automated test scenarios
Be responsible for planning and carrying out automated tests
Make reports about automated tests
Anticipate and hunt down bugs

YOUR PROFILE
Bachelor’s degree in IT and knowledge of javascript
At least 2 years’ experience in testing
Knowledge of ISTQB
Knowledge of automated testing tools (testcafe, cucumber, selenium, etc.)
Knowledge of at least one performance-oriented tool (K6, junit, load runner, etc.)
Open minded
End to end view capability
Stress resistant
Curious and quality oriented

What We Offer

As well as having a unique experience - centered around our values of pleasure, team spirit, performance, boldness and integrity - alongside 1,200 employees around the world, we offer:
the opportunity to contribute to the international development of a family company from Liège
the chance to take part in a human and entrepreneurial adventure within a solid group
a friendly work environment that is adapted to reaching optimal performance
leadership by talents, values, trust and autonomy
the opportunity to progress and specialize with our internal mobility system
a competitive salary package with several perks
the possibility to work remotely up to 50% for a good work-life balance

THE INTERVIEW PROCESS

Gaming1's NEWS

In May 2021, Gaming1 will move to the heart of the Ardent City. Immerse yourself in our new offices.

We are certified Top Employers 2022! We are the first game of chance company (casino, sports betting and poker) to receive this certification, among some 80 companies certified in our country, and including only 15% in Wallonia.

The health of our employees is our priority, we offer 50% remote working, as well as health and safety measures. Various activities are organized throughout the year, such as giving blood in the building’s courtyard, teambuilding days and the #loveyourhealth program which gives employees the opportunity to take part in various sporting activities.

More, the perks card offered to all Gaming1 employees. Browse the list of reductions.

About the job

Looking to make an impact? Work on a team that emphasises collaboration and innovation? At SailPoint, we believe our success is directly tied to our corporate culture. Our Core Values, affectionately also known as the “Four I’s”: Innovation, Integrity, Impact, and Individuals inform the work we do here at SailPoint. and because they are independent of scale, they have served us well from our early days as a start-up through today as the fastest-growing, independent identity and access management (IAM) provider.

Why SailPoint?
Love what you do. And love where you do it.
Smart people, fun culture, innovative work, collaborative on-site and remote environments — oh, and everyone’s really nice. That’s what people say about SailPoint. We’re known as the company where everyone wants to work.
If you’re passionate about outsmarting cybercriminals and working at a company where you can truly have an impact, we want you to join us in either Germany, Poland, Switzerland, or the Netherlands remotely.
SailPoint empowers the largest, most complex organisations by putting identity at the Centre of Security and IT. Our 2,000+ customers including global financial institutions, government entities, pharmaceutical organizations, and retail organizations and more.

What you’ll Do:

The Implementation Engineer (part of Professional Services) plays a vital role in the successful setup, integration, and deployment of SailPoint’s SaaS (Identity Now) service offerings. This role will be working in our German market, requiring proficiency in both English and German. Implementation Engineers begin their journey at SailPoint with product training where they can leverage their professional experience to gain a deep understanding of our SaaS (Identity Now) solution. Within a month or two, they begin serving as technical engineers on customer projects. In these projects, they will employ their industry knowledge, technical and communication skills to implement organisational best practices for SailPoint products and identity governance. Within six months, Implementation Engineers will have established themselves as technically proficient and reliable team members within Professional Services, able to handle large, complex projects under the guidance of a Solution Architect. By the end of their first year, they will have become a trusted resource capable of providing world-class service with minimal supervision.

Responsibilities:
Working with customers on the installation, integration, and deployment of SailPoint SaaS products.
Configuring SailPoint product as defined by Solution Architect.
Communicating to clients and partners aspects of both the product and the implementation at the technical and/or functional level.
Delivering technical training designed to enable/educate SailPoint customers and implementation partners.

Requirements:
3-5 years of professional work experience as part of a software company or systems integrator. This should include 2+ years of SaaS implementation experience
Excellent communication skills (German and English) and experience working with clients and partners.
Experience with some or all the following:
Angular JS, Java, Bean Shell/JavaScript, JSP/Servlets, SQL.
Web technologies: XML, SPML, SOAP, REST, Web / Application Servers, HTML.
Setting up and installing software on both Windows and Unix
RDMS Database Knowledge: Oracle, Sybase, MSSQL, MySQL.
Experience with enterprise directories such as Microsoft Active Directory and LDAP.
Networking principles: SSL/TLS/HTTPS, Certificate Management, Basic TCP/IP troubleshooting.
Familiarity with cloud technologies: AWS, Azure, GCP.

Preferred:
SailPoint or other identity governance vendors such as Microsoft, Sun, Oracle, IBM, or Novell a plus
Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts a plus
Familiarity with role-based access controls and least-privileged access models a plus
Experience with project management duties (project planning, resource management, scope, schedule and status, documentation)
Experience with quality assurance duties is a plus (usability testing, performance testing, automated testing, test scripts, test cases and test plans)
Security software or IT audit experience
Other languages such as French, Spanish or Italian are desirable but not essential

Education:
Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience. J2EE certification is a plus. CISSP certification is a plus.

Location:
Germany, Poland, Switzerland, or the Netherlands

Travel:
This position requires up to 15% travel,


SailPoint is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome everyone to our team. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

About the job
Vendo (https://www.getvendo.com/) is a all-in-one SaaS eCommerce platform for marketplaces. We'd need your help to develop new features & integrations while keeping bugs under control.

This is a long-term and 100% remote work position in a fast-growing, high-intensity SasS product company. We are passionate about our product and are excited about the opportunity to be a market leader.


So, what will I do?
Work in a team with fellow engineers and stakeholders
Design, Implement, Gather Feedback, Iterate - this is not a task-taking job, this will require you to implement, improve and deploy features from A to Z. And talk to people.
Our team is composed of people all around the globe and English is the primary language of communication.
We keep our meetings as short as possible (usually a daily standup and occasional pair programming) to create a distraction-free zone.
You can freely speak to the CTO and CEO at any time, you should speak to them as often as you can.
Work with modern and well-proven tech-stack
We use Ruby 3 and Rails 7 with Hotwire to build great interactive UIs for our customers as well as integrations with a number of 3rd party APIs - e-commerce platforms (Shopify, WooCommerce, Magento, etc), payment gateways (Stripe), tax services, and many others with REST and GraphQL
This will require both backend and some frontend skills to develop features end-to-end
We process millions of jobs with Sidekiq
TDD and CI & CD to deliver the best quality code (which will also be tested via static analyzer tools)

Requirements
Must-haves
Product-oriented approach
At least 3 years of commercial experience working with Ruby on Rails
Good team player skills
Great communication skills
Excellent knowledge of Sidekiq and background processing of large volumes of data
Hotwire experience, we use both Turbo and Stimulus
Efficiency in writing automatic tests (Capybara/rspec) or similar
Experience working with 3rd party APIs such as payment gateways, fulfillment providers, tax services, analytics, marketing automation
Good knowledge of building performant SQL queries
Ability to deliver the feature from 0 to 1 and take ownership of it
Nice-to-haves
Experience working with Shopify, Woo Commerce, BigCommerce or Magento/Adobe Commerce API
Experience developing Spree or Solidus apps is a great plus
ElasticSearch and Redis knowledge is a big plus

The recruitment process:
Get-to-know call with our CTO
A Test Task. This task shouldn’t take more than 4-5 hours to complete. The goal is not to have a fully implemented solution, work-in-progress is more than enough! We just want to see how you would approach this challenge
Feedback on your test task solution
Job offer and paperwork

Compensation & Benefits
Compensation $3,800 - $5,150 to your bank account
Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP)
20 paid vacation days a year
Paid sick leave up to a week a year
Evaluation Process every 6 months (your job satisfaction survey, your team feedback, your manager feedback, compensation review)
