We are looking for someone who brings solid experience with automation testing tools for mobile apps, experience in API testing with tools such as Postman, Charles or Proxyman, strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, and are happy to work to work independently within a team-centric environment.

Responsibilities:

Manual black box and white box testing of iOS and Android apps
Autotests creation and maintenance ( Java, Appium, BrowserStack)
Testing activities estimation, prioritization, and execution
Test documentation creation

5+ years full-time QA Automation engineering experience

Experience in API testing with tools such as Postman, Charles or Proxyman
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
Strong knowledge of QA processes and concepts including test case preparation and automated testing methodologies

About the job
About The Project

The task of the project is to carry out strategic research and development programs, as well as to support Polish scientific units and enterprises in developing their ability to create and use solutions based on the results of scientific research in order to give a developmental boost to the economy and for the benefit of society.

Our expectations

min 3.5 years of experience in application design, development and implementation,
Very good knowledge of tools: npm, webpack, eslint,
Knowledge of the basics of Agile methodology and working in the Scrum framework,
Strong sense of UI aesthetics, knowledge of UX issues and experience in putting them into practice,
Experience in scaling applications,
Meeting at least two of the following requirements:
Knowledge of at least two of the following technologies: WSL,Websocket, Docker, MongoDB, RabbitMQ, Redis, Nginx, GraphQL,
Knowledge of JSON Schema standard,
knowledge of at least one of the following libraries: Redux, Toolkit/Thunk, Yup, Formik, i18next, Lodash, Styled Components,
Familiarity with at least one of the following testing or component prototyping libraries: Jest, Karmo, Mocha,Puppeteer, Jasmine, Storybook,
Knowledge of at least one of the popular component libraries:Material UI, Ant Design, React Bootstrap, Carbon Design, Semantic, UI.

‍

Welcome

Key tasks

Development of a proprietary system to support the organization's day-to-day operations,
Support for the software under development,
Working with a team of developers, analysts, testers and UX designers in an agile Scrum framework,
Documenting and testing applications;
adherence to the principles of personal data security and principles of information confidentiality.

‍

What We Offer

Unique atmosphere - Good and friendly atmosphere in the company and satisfaction with cooperation with both colleagues in the department and direct superiors.
Team building events - Large, internal technology conferences, star parties and team outings.
Flexibility - Working hours are flexible and tailored to individual preferences. As is the mode of work provision: remotely or in a hybrid model.
Development paths - They are clear, straightforward and certainly not bumpy. You can choose a managerial or expert development path.
Certifications - We facilitate the development of desired competencies and subsidize training and courses.
Security - We have many years of experience in the market and have implemented national and international projects. We skillfully manage tasks and enable smooth allocation between projects.
Knowledge sharing - For those who want to grow, we have internal technology meetings and proprietary training programs. You can learn from the best, and share your knowledge and experience at company and industry technology conferences.
Private medical care - We take care of your health. We provide access to private medical care and the possibility of group insurance.
Multisport - Swimming pool, gym, dancing, yoga, martial arts. And all this with the card in the PLUS version. Ideal solution for sports fans and amateurs of active leisure.
English - For those who speak fluently and want to maintain this level or wish to develop their language skills, we enable free participation in English classes. Lessons are conducted in a modern and safe form of online meetings. Just learn IT!
Work comfort - Attractively decorated relaxation areas, available in the company's largest branches, to encourage relaxation during the day, and equipped kitchens with aromatic coffee.
Supporting activity - We have soccer teams, we play championships, we have marathon runners and other active sports lovers on board. We support all kinds of passions.

About the job
Why SoftwareONE?

Support Engineer (gn) Microsoft Sharepoint

Vollzeit, unbefristet, Standort: Bundesweit an einem unserer Standorte oder im Homeoffice

SoftwareONE ist ein weltweit führendes Plattform-, Lösungs- und Dienstleistungsunternehmen und unterstützt Organisationen mit innovativen Lösungen bei der Budgetierung sowie Optimierung ihrer globalen IT‐Kosten von On‐Premises- bis hin zu Cloud-Umgebungen. Wir verfügen über umfassende Expertise, Kunden im Sinne einer optimalen Cloud-Strategie zu beraten und Geschäftserfolge durch eine Cloud-Infrastruktur dauerhaft zu steigern. Im Bereich MultiVendor Helpdesk leisten wir Support für 11 Hersteller.

The role
Du reagierst auf akute Vorfälle in komplexen IT-Umgebungen unserer Geschäftskunden im 2nd und 3rd Level Support
Anhand deiner Erfahrung und technischen Expertise erarbeiten du und dein Team Lösungsvorschläge
Du nimmst eigenständig Kontakt zum Kunden auf und begleitest ihn bis zur Lösung des Problems
Wenn nötig involvierst du den Hersteller und koordinierst die weitere Abstimmung
Du dokumentierst deine Arbeit im ITIL-konformen Ticketsystem
Du arbeitest flexibel (In Abstimmung mit den Kollegen) zwischen 7 und 20 Uhr
Außerhalb dieser Zeit leistest du Rufbereitschaften (Maximal 1 Woche im Monat)
Du bildest dich regelmäßig persönlich und technisch weiter

What We Need To See From You

Erfahrung in einem oder mehreren der folgenden Bereiche ist wünschenswert:
SharePoint 2013, 2016 oder 2019, vorzugsweise auch Office 365
Erfahrung mit den Komponenten und Diensten innerhalb von SharePoint-Farmen
Konfigurieren und Steuern von SharePoint mit PowerShell
Bereitstellung von SharePoint-Farmen
Fehleranalyse und Leistungsoptimierung von SharePoint-Farmen
Idealerweise Kenntnisse über relevante Drittsysteme wie Active (Azure) Directory, SQL Server und System Center Operations Manager

Darüber Hinaus Bringst Du Die Folgenden Soft-Skills Mit
Du arbeitest kunden- und lösungsorientiert
Du liebst es Dinge zu reparieren
Du kannst komplexe Sachverhalte schnell durchschauen
Du kennst Prozesse und Abläufe innerhalb von Matrixorganisationen
Du sprichst und schreibst verhandlungssicher deutsch und englisch

Das haben wir zu bieten:
Eine Karriere bei einem zukunftssicheren Unternehmen mit einer einmaligen Unternehmenskultur
Eine top Mitarbeiter-Bewertung auf kununu!
Wir bieten die Möglichkeit zum Arbeiten im Homeoffice. Aber auch im Office haben wir keinen Dresscode und du kannst anziehen womit auch immer du dich wohl fühlst.
Eine Vielzahl an Weiterbildungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten die sich an deinen Interessen und Bedürfnissen orientieren
Eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance mit der Möglichkeit zum Sabbatical
Eine offene Kommunikationskultur sowie vielfältige Möglichkeiten zur aktiven Mitgestaltung und Verantwortungsübernahme
Ein modernes und faires Vergütungsmodell, das sich an deiner Qualifikation, deiner Verantwortung und deinem Erfolg orientiert
Mit unserem Mitarbeiteraktienprogramm kannst auch du finanziell an unserem weiteren Erfolg teilhaben
Umfangreiche Mitarbeiterangebote und legendäre gemeinsame Events
Eine top technische Ausstattung für deinen neuen Job!
Ein erprobtes und solides Onboarding

Interessiert?

Dann bewirb dich mit deinem Lebenslauf und wenigen Klicks über unser Online-Formular! Es ist kein Anschreiben nötig.

Du hast noch eine Frage? Dann kannst du uns gern eine E-Mail an malte.ruetten@softwareone.com senden.

About the job
TAMESHI is a Certified AWS Advanced Consulting Partner. We are dynamically growing up company. An experienced team offers a vast spectrum of knowledge in the scope of cloud technologies: AWS dedicated solutions in the form of migration into an AWS cloud, centralized log systems that enable to build awareness of your own business, as well as tailored DevOps tools. Working for local and international companies, banks and fintech corporations.

We are looking for Devops Engineers, both less and more experienced.

Deploying infrastructure with any container orchestration platforms such as: Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, OpenShift, AWS Container Service (ECS), AWS Elastic Kubernetes Service

Monitoring systems

Ability to work remotely
And money, off course, good money ;)

job_title: Customer Experience Specialist – European Languages (Budapest based – Remote work not available)
description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

Agoda’s Customer Support Team understands that travel can be an everchanging environment. That is why we provide in-person, real-time help around the clock and in 38 languages. No matter the issue, we present the best of Agoda’s values to each and every customer with multiple support channels and a strong desire to serve. Certainly doing more than answering phone calls or replying to emails, our specialists actively look for ways to improve our customer’s experience. We quickly adapt to challenges by collaborating with other teams and experimenting on everything we can. This has allowed us to develop new and effective products that produce meaningful results and continue to drive Agoda’s business performance. Our Customer Support Team serves a daily role in contributing to a core strength and service of Agoda with a clear vision and a focus on efficient and satisfying customer support.

In this Role, you’ll get to:

To deliver excellent customer service and manage the needs of our customers (guests and partners) through our communication channels (phone and email)
Understand and deliver business strategies and improve customer services through the execution of self-service
Accountable for meeting individual and team goals (KPIs)
Continuously identify work process improvements and communicate to Team Leaders and (or) Manager

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

Must have advanced command of spoken and written English & Italian OR German OR French (level C1 or higher according to The Common European Framework)
Immaculate telephone manners and communication skills
Excellent listening skills, critical-thinker with attention to detail
Minimum typing speed of 35 words per minute
Willing to work on rotating shifts, public holidays, and weekends
Ability to work in both a team environment and independently
Demonstrate high degree of integrity and confidentiality

It’s Great if you have:

At least 1 year of working experience in the related field would be desirable although fresh graduates are welcome to apply

#EC1 #budapest #Hungary #Italy #Latvia #Portugal #Lisbon #France #CUST #2 #Germany #Berlin #Dusseldorf #Izmir #Ankara #Malta #Madrid

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

About the job
Employer: Swiss IT Company Location: Remotely Salary: up to 7500 Euro net per month on B2B Cooperation model: B2B Start date: ASAP Recruitment process: only 1 step (technical interview) Technology stack: Kubernetes, Docker, Jenkins, Gitlab, Java 8/17, Spring, React, Selenium, REST, WebSocket, FIX, SQL, NoSQL, Maven, Nexus, Jira. Team: 20-person Scrum team responsible for separate microservices.

Our Client is a Swiss Company related to blockchain technology.

The company is a leader in managing both digital & crypto assets trading. By assisting the entire lifecycle infrastructure of digital trading assets, the company provides safe and hassle-free solutions for financial institutions.

Working for a leader in digital asset trading is an exclusive opportunity to get involved in revolutionary blockchain technology, which is one of the fastest developing technologies, gaining more and more applications in various areas.

Currently, we are looking for a DevOps Engineer to the team based in our Client's offices in Poznan and Wroclaw who will be involved in CI/CD process related to strategic features for the main Client's product.

Your role is: -> Design and implementation of CI/CD pipelines for Development and QA teams; -> Design and implementation of automation for provisioning infrastructure (IaaC) and deployments; -> Design and implementation of our monitoring stack for internal and SaaS deployments; -> Day-to-day, cloud infrastructure maintenance. Your skills and experiences: -> 2+ years of experience in DevOps; -> Experience with container orchestration (Docker and Kubernetes); -> Experience with Jenkins/Gitlab; -> Experience with Terraform/Ansible; -> Strong knowledge of cloud platforms AWS or Azure; -> Monitoring and observability tooling; -> Understanding of disaster recovery and high availability concepts; -> CI/CD, process automation; -> Understanding of networking concepts; -> Familiarity with Linux; -> Strong spoken and written English (min B2). Nice to have: + Experience with Hetzner cloud, Java/Maven, and Keycloak. Our client offers: + BYOD (bring your own device) program - additional financial bonus 85 EURO/monthly for 2 years; + Great opportunity for personal development in a stable and friendly large multinational company; + Frequent company events; + Flexible working hours. If interested, please apply safely through this portal (application rules are in accordance with GDPR). Employment agency Nr 17138.

job_title: Stage Développeur Web : Expérience Utilisateur H/F
description:
About the job
Job Description

Technip Energies - Ensemble, repousser les limites pour façonner un avenir durable.

Technip Energies est une entreprise d’ingénierie et des technologies de premier plan au service de la transition énergétique, avec des positions de leader dans le Gaz Naturel Liquéfié (GNL), l'hydrogène et l'éthylène et avec une présence forte sur les marchés en croissance de l'hydrogène bleu et vert, la chimie durable, les éoliennes marines flottantes et la capture et stockage du CO2. L’entreprise bénéficie de son solide modèle de livraison de projet, soutenu par une offre étendue de technologies, de produits et de services.

Forts de nos engagements de Diversité & Inclusion et de Développement Durable ( ici ), avec une présence dans 34 pays, nos 15 000 collaborateurs sont pleinement engagés à donner vie aux projets innovants de nos clients, en repoussant les limites du possible pour accélérer la transition énergétique vers un avenir meilleur.

Missions proposées :

Nous recherchons un nouveau profil pour renforcer l’équipe travaillant à la mise en place du PLM et en particulier pour travailler sur l’Expérience Utilisateur. Les premiers modules du PLM sont en cours de test et seront déployés courant 2023.

Vos missions seront les suivantes :

Lors des phases de test des modules, prendre en compte les retours utilisateur concernant l’interface. Comprendre les besoins et être force de proposition pour améliorer l’interface, en lien avec les équipes Information Management et de Développement.
De même lors des phases de déploiement des modules, prendre en compte les retours des utilisateurs. Les rencontrer pour mieux comprendre le besoin et être force de proposition pour améliorer l’interface utilisateur, en lien avec les équipes Information Management et de Développement.
De façon globale, proposer des améliorations de l’interface utilisateur (page d’accueil, navigation etc), en respectant les contraintes de développement.
Mettre en œuvre les améliorations proposées en appliquant la méthodologie Agile suivie par l’équipe de Développement (participation à des sprints et intégration dans l’équipe des développeurs, utilisation de AzureDevOps et codage en JavaScript).

Profil recherché :

Vous préparez un Bac+2 en informatique (de type BTS services informatiques aux organisations, BUT informatique, Licence pro mention métiers de l’informatique).
Vous maitrisez le codage sur JavaScript.
Vous savez ce qu’est un PLM.
Vous pouvez présenter des solutions aux utilisateurs.
Vous détenez un bon relationnel, une capacité à interagir avec différents intervenants, à faire des présentations devant de petits groupes d’utilisateurs et à discuter avec eux pour comprendre le besoin.
Vous avez l’esprit d’équipe et êtes une personne proactive.
Vous parlez couramment anglais (indispensable).

Toutes nos offres sont ouvertes aux personnes en situation de handicap.

Rejoignez-nous !

Et la suite ?

Retrouvez toutes nos offres sur notre site carrière :

https://careers.hr.technipenergies.com/

Pour un savoir plus sur Technip Energies rendez-vous sur Youtube : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8Mxj9h6vUjk

Retrouvez tous nos engagements ESG sur la page suivante :

https://www.technipenergies.com/sustainability

About the job

Looking to make an impact? Work on a team that emphasises collaboration and innovation? At SailPoint, we believe our success is directly tied to our corporate culture. Our Core Values, affectionately also known as the “Four I’s”: Innovation, Integrity, Impact, and Individuals inform the work we do here at SailPoint. and because they are independent of scale, they have served us well from our early days as a start-up through today as the fastest-growing, independent identity and access management (IAM) provider.

Why SailPoint?
Love what you do. And love where you do it.
Smart people, fun culture, innovative work, collaborative on-site and remote environments — oh, and everyone’s really nice. That’s what people say about SailPoint. We’re known as the company where everyone wants to work.
If you’re passionate about outsmarting cybercriminals and working at a company where you can truly have an impact, we want you to join us in either Germany, Poland, Switzerland, or the Netherlands remotely.
SailPoint empowers the largest, most complex organisations by putting identity at the Centre of Security and IT. Our 2,000+ customers including global financial institutions, government entities, pharmaceutical organizations, and retail organizations and more.

What you’ll Do:

The Implementation Engineer (part of Professional Services) plays a vital role in the successful setup, integration, and deployment of SailPoint’s SaaS (Identity Now) service offerings. This role will be working in our German market, requiring proficiency in both English and German. Implementation Engineers begin their journey at SailPoint with product training where they can leverage their professional experience to gain a deep understanding of our SaaS (Identity Now) solution. Within a month or two, they begin serving as technical engineers on customer projects. In these projects, they will employ their industry knowledge, technical and communication skills to implement organisational best practices for SailPoint products and identity governance. Within six months, Implementation Engineers will have established themselves as technically proficient and reliable team members within Professional Services, able to handle large, complex projects under the guidance of a Solution Architect. By the end of their first year, they will have become a trusted resource capable of providing world-class service with minimal supervision.

Responsibilities:
Working with customers on the installation, integration, and deployment of SailPoint SaaS products.
Configuring SailPoint product as defined by Solution Architect.
Communicating to clients and partners aspects of both the product and the implementation at the technical and/or functional level.
Delivering technical training designed to enable/educate SailPoint customers and implementation partners.

Requirements:
3-5 years of professional work experience as part of a software company or systems integrator. This should include 2+ years of SaaS implementation experience
Excellent communication skills (German and English) and experience working with clients and partners.
Experience with some or all the following:
Angular JS, Java, Bean Shell/JavaScript, JSP/Servlets, SQL.
Web technologies: XML, SPML, SOAP, REST, Web / Application Servers, HTML.
Setting up and installing software on both Windows and Unix
RDMS Database Knowledge: Oracle, Sybase, MSSQL, MySQL.
Experience with enterprise directories such as Microsoft Active Directory and LDAP.
Networking principles: SSL/TLS/HTTPS, Certificate Management, Basic TCP/IP troubleshooting.
Familiarity with cloud technologies: AWS, Azure, GCP.

Preferred:
SailPoint or other identity governance vendors such as Microsoft, Sun, Oracle, IBM, or Novell a plus
Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts a plus
Familiarity with role-based access controls and least-privileged access models a plus
Experience with project management duties (project planning, resource management, scope, schedule and status, documentation)
Experience with quality assurance duties is a plus (usability testing, performance testing, automated testing, test scripts, test cases and test plans)
Security software or IT audit experience
Other languages such as French, Spanish or Italian are desirable but not essential

Education:
Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience. J2EE certification is a plus. CISSP certification is a plus.

Location:
Germany, Poland, Switzerland, or the Netherlands

Travel:
This position requires up to 15% travel,


SailPoint is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome everyone to our team. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

About the job
Site Name: Poznan Business Garden

Posted Date: Feb 8 2023

Hello. We’re Haleon. A new world-leading consumer health company. Shaped by all who join us. Together, we’re improving everyday health for billions of people. By growing and innovating our global portfolio of category-leading brands – including Sensodyne, Panadol, Advil, Voltaren, Theraflu, Otrivin, and Centrum – through a unique combination of deep human understanding and trusted science. What’s more, we’re achieving it in a company that we’re in control of. In an environment that we’re co-creating. And a culture that’s uniquely ours. Care to join us. It isn’t a question.

We are looking for an experienced Cyber Security Analyst to join our Global CISO team in Poland Tech Hub.

Cyber Security Analyst

As a Subject Matter Expert you will support the Third-Party Security Risk Management processes to ensure cyber security risks that may be introduced by third-parties are understood, managed or mitigated.

The Cyber Security Analyst will engage with senior stakeholders from Business groups, Procurement, Finance, Legal, and third-party representatives to understand business imperatives and the cyber security risk posture of third-party providers. The ability to analyse cyber security risks and articulate findings to both technical and non-technical functions is essential in order to ensure appropriate cyber security controls are in place prior to the onboarding of third parties. This requires attention to detail and resourcefulness beyond compromise.

The role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career! These responsibilities include:

Complete supplier cybersecurity assessments and reports in line with departmental procedures and processes.
Maintain and mature the third-party risk management process framework for security risk, including necessary standards, procedures, and technologies
Provide clarifying support, where necessary, to internal third-party relationship owners or third-party representatives in their efforts to provide responses to the security risk assessment questionnaire.
Coordinate with Legal and Procurement representatives to ensure proper security and privacy clauses are included in third-party contracts
Effectively translate third-party responses to assessment questionnaire, using sound judgement, into concise risk exposure reporting for delivery to internal stakeholders
Collaborate with internal third-party relationship owners and external third-party representatives to recommend necessary security controls to effectively mitigate risks to Haleon
Ensure robust tracking and remediation of third-party security and privacy risk exposures identified through assessment processes

Why you?

Qualifications & Skills:

2+ years of experience in Information Security Risk Management, Cybersecurity, or Third Party Risk Management
Demonstrated experience and understanding of cyber security principles, IT security controls, and related technologies and products
Experience and knowledge across different frameworks and standards such as ISO 27001, NIST, CIS etc.
Prior experience conducting risk assessments and applying concepts of inherent and residual risk in order to draw appropriate conclusions and articulate the same to non-technical audiences.
Strong verbal/written communication in English, with the ability to effectively interact with professionals at all levels of responsibility and authority

Preferred Qualifications & Skills:

Ability to operates autonomously in the execution of the third-party security risk program framework
Influencing action across various business lines and geographies to achieve program objectives.
Ability to effectively manage conflicting priorities in alignment with overall business and departmental strategies.
Working and co-operating with virtual teams located in different countries around the world, aligning and adapting different work, culture and communication styles.
An awareness of information and application cybersecurity techniques, common vulnerabilities, and emerging exploits. Broader knowledge of information security and operational technology controls, technologies and processes.

Opportunities for growth

None of us should ever feel like we are standing still. Instead, we want Haleon to be a place where we feel like we are always progressing.

Improving everyday health takes dedication. Energy. Effort. So we look to reward your contribution with a benefits package that includes:

Hybrid@Haleon our philosophy to hybrid work – performance with choice or fully remote work
A competitive base salary
Contract of employment
Attractive annual bonuses
Life insurance and pension plan
Private medical package with additional preventive healthcare services for employees and their eligible
Sports cards (Multisport)
Paid Referral Program
Health and wellbeing programs that take care of you physically and mentally
Possibilities of development within the role and company’s structure

Why Join Us?

The future of everyday health is changing. And we’re the people changing it. In front of us is an incredible opportunity to go beyond what any of us have done before. And make everyday health more achievable, more inclusive and more sustainable. For more and more people. So join us, as we build one of the world’s leading consumer healthcare companies. Join us to innovate our category-leading brands. To better understand people’s everyday health needs. To tackle the biggest barriers that stand in their way. To change individual and societal behavior.  Join us to work with colleagues who share your restless energy. To explore your interests. To stretch yourself to do the best work of your career. And join us, as together we build a working experience that encourages us all to lead happier, healthier, more productive lives.  The way we see it, every day is an opportunity for better. And we’re going all in to realize it.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create an unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone.

We’re striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives.

We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.

Care to join us. Find out what life at Haleon is really like www.haleon.com/careers/

At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone. We're striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives. About the job
Are you looking to be in a workplace where colleagues inspire one another? Are you interested in competitive and impactful benefits? Do you prefer flexible work arrangements?

The Application Analyst provides technical support aligned with a specific product vertical to a mix of technical and non-technical customers by diagnosing, troubleshooting, repairing and debugging complex software and/or networked systems. You will have frequent phone and email interaction with our customers and require the development of in-depth technical product, SQL, network and server knowledge and exceptional customer service skills.

On a daily basis, the Application Analyst creates, resolves, and maintains tickets, while working within their product vertical to resolve issues and escalate tickets to other teams and verticals. It is essential that the Application Analyst maintains accurate records of all activities and interactions in Salesforce and responds to clients within identified service level agreements. You will inform management of important issues regarding personnel, performance, client perception, and project statuses, and work with colleagues to ensure quality service. This role will report to the Manager of Customer Support. The working hours are based on rotational shifts, (including nights, weekends, and public holidays), where shifts rotate or change according to a set schedule published in advance

Your Role in Action: Technical Skills/Responsibilities

Use SQL applications and tools to run basic SQL queries
Respond to client questions, problems, and work requests on a daily basis
Develop an expertise in company products and services and the initiative to take an active role in sharing this knowledge with customers
Partner with senior level team members as needed to troubleshoot and resolve customer incidents
Have or develop the experience to capably perform the Application Analyst position responsibilities

Policy And Procedure Skills

Follow appropriate procedures for creating, categorizing, updating, escalating, transitioning, and resolving tickets. Attention to proper detail when coding and documenting tickets is essential for accurate reporting and maintaining historical ticket data
Monitor assigned open tickets, contact customers, and update tickets on a timely basis
Provide responsive support to clients during normal shift hours, when scheduled for early and late shifts, and as identified for on-call or as requested by management. Early/Late shifts and on-call could be required of the qualified Application Analyst staff
Complete all daily tasks and projects
Track time daily

Expectations of the Role

Provide excellent customer service using the communication methods designated by Relativity
Is flexible to work rotational shifts (including nights, weekends, and public holidays), where shifts rotate or change according to a set schedule published in advance
Demonstrate initiative to learn new skills, such as SQL applications and tools to run basic SQL queries
Meet identified goals regarding customer service tech support metrics
Commitment to and consistent demonstration of core company values

Your Skills

Customer support experience
Client-focused and ability to understand expectations
Direct experience supporting clients as a primary contact or lead using phone and email
Experience troubleshooting complex issues
SQL and Windows platform experience
Travel 10% of the time

Relativity is a diverse workplace with different skills and life experiences—and we love and celebrate those differences. We believe that employees are happiest when they're empowered to be their full, authentic selves, regardless how you identify.

Relativity is a diverse workplace with different skills and life experiences—and we love and celebrate those differences. We believe that employees are happiest when they're empowered to be their full, authentic selves, regardless how you identify.

Benefit Highlights

Comprehensive health plans

Flexible work arrangements

Two, week-long company breaks per year

Unlimited time off

Equity program

Training investment program

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

job_title: IT Customer Service Associate with German
description:
About the job
IT Customer Service Associate with German

Key Responsibilities:

• Receives and logs internal and/or external customer problem/request/issue and ensures proper documentation
• Performs customer request/problem identification and follows defined procedures to resolve correctly. Documents troubleshooting efforts and customer information in data capture tool and when required, transfers call or promptly notifies responsible party for resolution
• Performs incident notification and escalation to ensure problems/requests/issues are communicated effectively and receive proper management attention
• Develops and maintains knowledge of customer specific business environment
• Develops and maintains an understanding of customer Service Level Agreements and department’s/product’s key performance requirements
• Develops and maintains product knowledge, industry knowledge, and business and professional skills by participating in on-the-job training and classroom training


Preferred Skills

• Customer Interaction Handling
• Problem Solving & Escalation Management
• Data Quality
• Organization skills, attention to detail and follow through to resolve any outstanding issues
• Good technical aptitude with an ability to learn quickly
• B2 min in German language and at least B2 in English
• Time management and administrative skills
• Written and verbal communication skills: manages internal communications and external/client communications
• Discretion, professionalism, confidentiality and judgment.
• Computer literacy and working knowledge of Microsoft Office
• Team player with interpersonal and conflict management skills
• Self-Motivated, positive attitude and approach.


Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.

About the job
Employer: Swiss IT Company Location: Remotely Salary: up to 7500 Euro net per month on B2B Cooperation model: B2B Start date: ASAP Recruitment process: only 1 step (technical interview) Technology stack: Kubernetes, Docker, Jenkins, Gitlab, Java 8/17, Spring, React, Selenium, REST, WebSocket, FIX, SQL, NoSQL, Maven, Nexus, Jira. Team: 20-person Scrum team responsible for separate microservices.

Our Client is a Swiss Company related to blockchain technology.

The company is a leader in managing both digital & crypto assets trading. By assisting the entire lifecycle infrastructure of digital trading assets, the company provides safe and hassle-free solutions for financial institutions.

Working for a leader in digital asset trading is an exclusive opportunity to get involved in revolutionary blockchain technology, which is one of the fastest developing technologies, gaining more and more applications in various areas.

Currently, we are looking for a DevOps Engineer to the team based in our Client's offices in Poznan and Wroclaw who will be involved in CI/CD process related to strategic features for the main Client's product.

Your role is: -> Design and implementation of CI/CD pipelines for Development and QA teams; -> Design and implementation of automation for provisioning infrastructure (IaaC) and deployments; -> Design and implementation of our monitoring stack for internal and SaaS deployments; -> Day-to-day, cloud infrastructure maintenance. Your skills and experiences: -> 2+ years of experience in DevOps; -> Experience with container orchestration (Docker and Kubernetes); -> Experience with Jenkins/Gitlab; -> Experience with Terraform/Ansible; -> Strong knowledge of cloud platforms AWS or Azure; -> Monitoring and observability tooling; -> Understanding of disaster recovery and high availability concepts; -> CI/CD, process automation; -> Understanding of networking concepts; -> Familiarity with Linux; -> Strong spoken and written English (min B2). Nice to have: + Experience with Hetzner cloud, Java/Maven, and Keycloak. Our client offers: + BYOD (bring your own device) program - additional financial bonus 85 EURO/monthly for 2 years; + Great opportunity for personal development in a stable and friendly large multinational company; + Frequent company events; + Flexible working hours. If interested, please apply safely through this portal (application rules are in accordance with GDPR). Employment agency Nr 17138.

About the job
Acreto is looking for an experienced Golang developer to join our team.

This developer will work directly with Data/Analytics branch of Acreto, for the purpose of creating scalable data pipelines that will be used for both internal and external reporting, data analysis, and eventually, ML solutions.

You will help us build our Acreto Cloud Security platform coined by Gartner as Secure Access Service Edge (SASE).

Join us! Come with us on our journey to change the face of security. We’re thrilled to work with you.

Responsibilities:
· Development of Golang-based backend system components
· Active participation in the architecture of the backend
· Participation in the Code Review process
· Creation of Automated data validation processes for the purpose of reporting
· Design and execution of pipelines into Acreto’s data warehouse for both long term and short-term analysis
· Creating indices and nodes in elastic for the purpose of time series analysis.

Must-Have Skills:
· Golang
· Elastic Cluster (7 or greater)
· DB (SQL, ORM, NOSQL)
· REST API
· Message Broker / Stream Processing: Kafka
· Microservice Architecture
· Network Protocols (TCP/IP, UDP, ICMP, DNS, HTTP)
· Git Versioning, Issue Tracking, Merge/Pull Requests
· Docker
· Basic Python Knowledge
· Basic SQL Knowledge

Nice to Have:
· Design and Implementation of Distributed Systems
· Public Key Infrastructure
· IPv6 fundamentals
· VPN fundamentals
· Public Cloud Providers (AWS, GCP, …)
· Test Automation
· CI/CD workflows

How we work:
· The majority of the team works remotely, but we have offices in the US and Europe.
· We need availability during European business hours

This is a full-time, long-term position. We are NOT looking for agencies for this position.

About Acreto
End-to-end, Zero-Trust security to protect anything, anywhere. One security from one provider to protect all your systems.Acreto seeks to democratize security. We have lived in a world where security consists of stacks of bulky, inflexible solutions that do not meet the needs of all users and require huge amounts of overhead to implement and operate. In a world of increasing insecurity, and with more and more assets being moved to a digital space, one of the great challenges of our time is securing our data, our businesses, and our lives. Acreto seeks to democratize the security of our digital spaces by providing an all-inclusive, robust, and customizable SASE platform for all.Join us on our journey to provide one of the most valuable assets in an uncertain world: security. As a member of the Acreto team, you will be engaged in an environment of brilliant, motivated problem-solvers, with a passion for building a game-changing security architecture; designing elegant and intuitive User front end control; crafting robust and meaningful representations of security data; and researching cutting edge cyber-security AI.

About the job
A great opportunity arises, in a team of professionals within dynamic Agile environment!

Black Peak Technologies is a next-generation arising IT services company, with open-minded, flexible and people-oriented culture where life-work balance is observed, and where your professional expertise is respected.

Microsoft SW Engineer

Annual salary review

Regular feedback

Come and join us!

About the job
Persönliche Entfaltung in der BI Welt von morgen!

Unserem Leitspruch «experience the sense of tomorrow» verpflichtet unterstützen wir zukunftsorientierte Kunden dabei, aus der Vielzahl ihrer Daten businessrelevante Informationen zu visualisieren und zuverlässige Unternehmenssteuerung in ein erfolgreiches Morgen zu ermöglichen. Wir bieten Dir eine vielseitige Herausforderung in einem professionellen und marketingorientierten Unternehmen an, welches die Digitalisierung vorantreibt und Dir die optimale Basis für eine zukunftsorientierte Entwicklung im Consulting ermöglicht. Bei uns kannst du visionär mitgestalten mit viel Eigenverantwortung in einem motivierenden und abwechslungsreichen Arbeitsumfeld. Du arbeitest in abwechslungsreichen Business Intelligence Projekten bei namhaften Kunden in verschiedensten Branchen. Deine Begeisterung für Daten, Selbständigkeit und Berufsstolz sind bereits gute Voraussetzungen, um mit uns ins Gespräch zu kommen.

Innerhalb unserer Wachstumsstrategie suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine hochmotivierte und engagierte Persönlichkeit für unseren Standort in Deutschland. Der Arbeitsort ist flexibel und grösstenteils arbeiten wir in Deutschland remote, es sollte aber eine gewisse Reisebereitschaft vorhanden sein.

Deine Aufgaben

Beratung von Kunden in vielfältigen BI-Themen im Zusammenspiel mit verschiedenen Quell- und Umsystemen
Unterstützung unseres Sales Teams bei der Gewinnung von Neukunden und dem nachhaltigen Ausbau unseres Kundenstamms
Mit Deinem koordinierten Vorgehen ermittelst Du den Informationsbedarf aus der Sicht unserer Kunden und bist entweder verantwortlich für die Beratung, Konzeptionierung, Planung, Entwicklung sowie der nachhaltigen Betreuung von BI- und Datawarehouse Lösungen auf der Basis von Microsoft Power Plattform und Data Integration (SQL-Server, Synapse, SSIS etc.) on Premises, Azure oder in HybridClouds oder von BI-Lösungen auf der Basis von Qlik und Jedox
Selbständige Durchführung von Projekten und Koordination mit dem Kunden

Dein Profil

Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium in der Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Erfahrung im Datawarehouse- und BI-Umfeld mit Microsoft Produkten insbesondere Power-BI und Synapse oder Erfahrung mit Qlik
Du verstehst Daten und sprichst SQL
Vorkenntnisse im Bereich SAP BI, SAP BW etc. sind ein Plus
Du hast eine hohe Kundenorientierung, gehst Herausforderungen gezielt an und es macht Dir Spass Projekte lösungs- und budgetorientiert mit und für Kunden umzusetzen
Du fühlst Dich wohl dabei, eine hohe Kommunikationskultur innerhalb von Projekten und Kundenbeziehungen zu etablieren
Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Reisebereitschaft innerhalb von Deutschland und der Schweiz

Unser Angebot
Eine vielseitige Herausforderung in einem spannenden, modernen Spielfeld und einem starken, erfahrenen Team. Es erwarten Dich ein moderner Arbeitsplatz, flexible Arbeitsbedingungen, spannende und herausfordernde Projekte. Bei uns kannst Du etwas bewegen!

Bist Du unsere Verstärkung? Dann bewirb Dich jetzt, wir freuen uns, Dich kennenzulernen.

job_title: Accounts Payable - Process Associate - Spanish - Remote RO
description:

With a startup spirit and 90,000+ curious and courageous minds, we have the expertise to go deep with the world’s biggest brands—and we have fun doing it! We dream in digital, dare in reality, and reinvent the ways companies work to make an impact far bigger than just our bottom line. We’re harnessing the power of technology and humanity to create meaningful transformation that moves us forward in our pursuit of a world that works better for people.

Now, we’re calling upon the thinkers and doers, those with a natural curiosity and a hunger to keep learning, keep growing. People who thrive on fearlessly experimenting, seizing opportunities, and pushing boundaries to turn our vision into reality. And as you help us create a better world, we will help you build your own intellectual firepower.

Welcome to the relentless pursuit of better.

Inviting applications for the role of Accounts Payable - Process Associate - Spanish - Remote RO!

Responsibility

Processing financial documents received from suppliers or employees of the customer following the standard operating procedures.
Checking supplier’s details in the predefined system.
Entering data accurately in the system.
Sending cases requiring resolution to the contact person agreed with the client in order to get them processed.
Debit balances for suppliers, if required.
Month end activities.
Proactive control for the prevention of possible errors.
Ad-hoc reports.
Resolving as soon as possible the requests received from partners or customers via email.
Maintain the relationship with the customer, understanding customer needs and find solutions consistent with the objectives set.
Solving customer requests within the time agreed.
Ensure that response time is within the limits set by the client and that deadlines are met.
Understand the client’s organization and address the people directly involved in the process.
Interact via email or phone with customer representatives.
Answering supplier/ Invoice Resolution/ Understand and Resolve Queries raised by vendor.
Provide information on the status of Invoices, relevant contact information (fax, telephone).
Routing out of scope issues to internal teams for further resolution.
Contact Suppliers (email/phone/fax) resolution related.
Work on aged invoices/ pending issues.
To ensure that the processes activities and transactions are finalized in an accurate and timely manner, and in accordance with pre-defined and coordinated controls (SOX & Audit).
Reading and learning the operating procedures, contributing to the development/improvement of the process procedures, raising of all unsolved/unclear issues to the team leader.
Adopt a flexible approach to job content with a view to developing skills and knowledge to undertake a range of task requirements within the team.

Maintain and develop relationships with relevant markets and clients serviced by team and all major customers within those markets as appropriate.

Similar experience in the field.
SAP knowledge (represents an advantage).

Highschool graduate
University student/ graduate (Economic studies, represents an advantage)
Required language level for daily tasks: Spanish B2 / English B1-B2

Attractive salary;
Stable job offers - employment contract

Benefits such as Meal Tickets, Medical Services, Insurance, additional vacation days or partner discounts

job_title: Digital Marketing Growth Hacker – SEO / PPC / CRO
description:
About the job
Position: Digital Marketing Growth Hacker – SEO / PPC / CRO
Contract: B2B - full time
Location: 100% Remote
Time Zone: UTC/GMT -5

We are a digital agency with a friendly team servicing clients in the United States. We help businesses grow by effectively managing their online presence; we provide web design, hosting, and online marketing services. Most of our clients are small businesses (25-500 employees) operating in various industries.

The goal is to find a Digital Marketing Growth Hacker (SEO, PPC, CRO) that will join and help us and our clients grow. This is an early stage and an excellent opportunity for the right applicant to join, and make a real impact.

ABOUT YOU
You are a confident individual with excellent communication skills
Fluent speaking, reading, and writing English (important)
Your attitude is very positive.
You take a problem or unknown as just another challenge.
Working remotely is what you prefer as it gives you freedom (and saves time on commuting).
You are the one that always goes an extra mile and is not shy of reaching out, asking for help, or proving your case.
A hectic environment makes you thrive, not die.
You have no problem leading a meeting
You love learning new things and finding a competitive edge
You have analytical mind and passion for building stories through data
You are an aspiring Marketing Growth Hacker looking for an opportunity to take on new challenges and advancing your career.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING
Create and execute digital marketing strategies that supports the wider business objectives.
Analyze campaigns, draw conclusions, and recommend changes
Create reports of how the effectiveness of marketing activity has helped drive new business, opportunities, and awareness.
Day-to-day management of tasks, deadlines, and commitments.
Build relationships and work collaboratively with internal team and clients.
Build stand-out (including provoking) campaigns to drive new brand awareness and lead generation
Help with sales and lead-generation techniques
Test and optimize marketing tactics for customer acquisition
Conduct and present competitive analyses
Be a part of many calls and brainstorming sessions with clients
Perform on-site and off-site website audits
Set up and analyze Google Analytics (including Enhanced Ecommerce and GA4)
Set up Google Tag Manager, and Google Search Console data
Set up Google Optimize and regularly recommend and implement A/B tests
Manage PPC campaigns in Google Ads, Microsoft Ads, Facebook Ads, and Linkedin.
Prepare, manage, and optimize Product Data Feed for Google Shopping campaigns
Plan and manage CTAs, triggers, frequency, and location.
Perform keyword research.
Prepare creative briefs for designers and content briefs for content writers based on research, competition analysis, gathered information from clients, and best practices.
Test and optimize marketing tactics for customer acquisition – Plan, delegate, publish and syndicate the content.

REQUIREMENTS
At least 5 years experience in digital marketing (preferably as a growth hacker)
At least 5 years of experience in PPC (mainly Google Ads, then Microsoft Ads, Facebook, and LinkedIn)
Fluent in reading, writing, and speaking English (this is a must)
Strong communication and grammar skills
Strong knowledge of online marketing (SEO, PPC, SMM, etc.)
Believe in White-hat SEO practices only
Good understanding of marketing terms (e.g. ROI, KPI, ROAS, CPC, CPA, CPV, etc.)
Understand the concept of Inbound Marketing
Desire to building and maintaining campaigns with long-lasting results
In-depth knowledge of SEO factors and key algorithm updates
Hands-on experience with web analytics and A/B testing tools (e.g., Google Optimize)
Expertise in UI/UX best practices
High standards of excellence and attention to detail
Self-starter with the ability to work independently and prioritize with little oversight

HOW TO STAND OUT?
Experience in Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
Experience in Performance Max campaigns of Google Ad
Experience in Server-side GTM (HTTP cookies)
Experience in Google Merchant Center
Experience in Google Tag Manager
Experience in Google Looker Studio (former Data Studio)
Experience in marketing on Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

Location/Language requirements. Please do NOT apply if you do not fit ALL 3 of the below-listed criteria.
INCORE is a completely remote team, but to apply, you must:
Have a high English proficiency level in speaking and writing ("rusty" is not acceptable)
Located within 6 hours time window of the Eastern Time zone (GMT-5).
Available to work during business hours in the Eastern Time zone (GMT-5).

About the job
About Chabre IT Services

Chabre IT Services is a global professional IT services provider, building long-lasting relationships with Enterprises. We specialize in the delivery of tailor-made solutions, smart outsourcing, try&hire, and success fee services. We are a smart IT boutique with unique knowledge, which will deliver your ideas into reality.

Our client is a company specialized in embedded software engineering based on various hardware platforms and operating systems (OS), including Linux, Android, FreeRTOS, RT Linux, Nucleus, VxWorks, Integrity RTOS and LynxOS, supporting OEMs and Tier 1 customers in a wide range of industries. They offer IT services that range from architecture, designing, engineering and developing to deployment of embedded software.

3+ Years of experience in agile project setup Scrum or Kanban

Following the modern and agile DevOps approach and working in Agile environment is not an obstacle for you
Experience with Typescript, IaC, CI/CD
Knowledgeable of Microservices
You are communicative team player with very good English language skills

Remote work

Working tool (MacBook Pro or Lenovo Legion 5)

About the job
Description

Guardian Industries, a global company headquartered in Auburn Hills, Michigan, employs more than 17,000 people and operates facilities throughout North America, Europe, South America, Africa, the Middle East and Asia. Guardian’s diverse group of companies are involved in the manufacture of high-performance float, coated and fabricated glass products and the manufacture of high-quality chrome-plated and painted plastic components for the automotive and commercial truck industries. Guardian’s vision is to create value for customers and society through constant innovation using fewer resources. Guardian is a wholly owned subsidiary of Koch Industries, Inc.

Guardian is looking for a Data Engineer (remote work) based in Spain or Poland.

Data Engineer is the subject matter expert on dimensional modeling techniques and data integration from external partners into transactional systems and through to the data warehousing and analytical platforms. The individual must be able to communicate in written form and manage workload dependencies. Strong analytical and problem solving skills are required.

What You Will Do In Your Role

Participate in analysis sessions to understand functional and non-functional requirements
Design DW tables base on dimensional modeling techniques (Kimball)
Create/develop code and jobs in Talend while following enterprise best practices
Provide technical insight and develop work estimates to project planners
Should be responsible for building extraction and mapping rules for loading data from multiple sources for data warehouse implementation based on AWS Snowflake
Must have strong knowledge on Data Warehousing (DWH) concepts, ETL concepts, data analysis capabilities and experience in the Talend Big-Data Real Time ETL tool.
Work with business users to translate requirements into system flows, data flows, data mappings etc., and develop solutions to complex business problems
Maintain workload and time tracking within Azure DevOps
Development experience working in Agile Scrum environment

The Experience You Will Bring

Requirements

Experience as a Data engineer with strong data architecture knowledge around data warehousing concepts, SQL development and optimization, and operational support models
Must have experience with Talend Big-Data Real Time Studio.
Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment that requires quick turnaround and quality output.
Experience with Azure DevOps
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously with minimal supervision

About the job
Grow with HiveMQ as we lead IoT messaging and connectivity

We are a fast-growing tech start-up looking to add to our team of innovative and motivated people. HiveMQ is a messaging platform for reliable, secure and scalable data movement to and from connected IoT devices. Our vision is a connected world where people and companies can unleash their full potential. Our flagship product, the HiveMQ MQTT broker, is used by over 130 customers to develop new connected products, improve efficiencies, and drive down costs.

HiveMQ originated in Landshut, Germany, and has grown into a global, remote-first company. The last time we counted, we spoke 32 languages within HiveMQ. Join us as we work to contribute to the fast moving development of the IoT ecosystem and help companies enable mission critical use cases like connected cars, logistics, Industry 4.0 and connected IoT products.

HiveMQ’s Vision for this role

The General Ledger Accountant will support the day-to-day business of group accounting, working closely with the accounting management. Additionally, you will support the professional and process-related optimization of the accounting function. Ensuring the overall success of the finance function and helping the company comply with the financial and regulatory requirements.

You will…

Preparing and recording journal entries
Perform month-end and year-end closing activities, including but not limited to reconciliations of general ledgers, sub-ledgers and record adjustments in the accounting system according to HGB and IFRS.
Support year-end closing process of local and global entities by preparing financial statements, generation of accounting and audit reports such as trial balance, related schedules, and other financial reports and liaising with external auditors
Administer the intercompany recharge process
Communicate and collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to solve challenges and blockers
Assist with implementing and maintaining internal financial controls and procedures
Assist with other accounting projects as required


You have…

A minimum of 5 years of work experience in Accounting, ideally in a fast-growing B2B tech, software, or SaaS environment
Very strong German and English verbal and written communication skills are required
A completed commercial vocational training as an Accountant (in German “Finanzbuchhalter”), a Bachelor/Master degree is a plus.
Knowledgeable in accounting software preferably (Datev and Oracle Netsuite)
German and EU VAT law
Hands-on mentality and entrepreneurial mindset; you are ready to roll up your sleeves to deliver alongside our team

About the job
Job Details

What You Will Do

Is Azure your top environment? Are you delivering PaaS & IaaS based analytics solutions? Join our international team, and support Azure Data Lake now and Azure Snowflake in the future!

How You Will Do It
Proactive administration & support of Azure Data Lake Platform including admin, incident management & troubleshooting
Be the point of contact for Azure PaaS services including Data Factory, ADLS, Databricks, Synapse & DevOps – Capacity/Cost tracking
Support & Maintain – Big Data Cluster – based on HD Insight, Azure Synapse & Hive
